If untapped after the strike, he may immediately tap to face a strike assigned to another character in his company; any resulting body check after this strike is modified by +1.

Balin specific. Place this card on Balin if he is in play. TAP: during your end-of-turn phase to search your play deck for a resource that requires one of Balin's skills to play, and take it into your hand. TAP: during your organization phase to look at three random cards from your opponent's hand. If any of these is a hazard creature playable at/in Balin's site or region, opponent places it on the bottom of his play deck.

Unique. Playable at Ruins of Belegost or Ruins of Nogrod if the company discards (for no effect) a Lost Knowledge card it controls. Weapon. Axe. +1 DI. Warrior only: +3 prowess to a maximum of 9 (if borne by a Dwarf, +5 prowess against Spawn, Dragons, and Drakes to a maximum of 11). Dwarf leader or Firebeard only: modifications to prowess and body from The Dwarves Are upon You! are doubled for all Firebeard Dwarves in the company.

Unique. Playable at Beorn's House or The Carrock, if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: Beornings (+2), character with Beorn's House or Woodmen-town as a home site (+3). Beorning Skin-changers cannot be played as event against your companies. When you play Beorning Skin-changers as a creature, rotate this card 90deg. This faction gives +1 MP for each time rotated (to a maximum of 4 MP).

Playable on a Dwarf-hold if you discard (for no effect) a technology item stored at (or placed with) the site. Factions you have in play at this site are never worth more than 1 MP. Opponent's companies may not enter any version of the site and agents may not move here. The roll required to move between any version of the site and its adjacent Under-deeps sites is 13. Discard if Breach the Hold is played on any of its adjacent sites. Opponent may tap 3 of his characters (or an avatar) at the site to discard this card. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

Unique. Ring. Manifestation of The One Ring. Playable at The Under-grottos if Gollum is not in play. May also be played after a failed attack from My Precious (instead of playing Gollum), if you tap a warrior, a scout, and a ranger in the company. +3 prowess, +3 body (to a maximum of 10), and +3 DI. +1 corruption point to all characters in bearer's company or at his site. Discard when placed "off to the side". You cannot play a resource that would allow you to win the game, except Gollum's Fate. May be tested as if a gold ring; discard when tested and make a roll to see which ring may be played: any unique ring (9+); any non-unique ring (any result).

Dwarf-lord only. Your Under-deeps movement rolls for companies moving to a site where a minion company is present are automatically successful. Each of your cards located at an Under-deeps site counts for the purpose of calling your Day of Reckoning. Cannot be duplicated by a player. You may discard this card at any time to cancel a Rock Fall attack against one of your companies or give all your Dwarves at an Under-deeps site +2 prowess in this turn.

Unique. Animal. Flying. Playable at any tapped or untapped non-Haven site in Northern Rhovanion. A Longbeard Dwarf may tap and play Carc from the discard pile. Place Carc in your sideboard to make Information playable at his site in Northern Rhovanion, Southern Rhovanion, Iron Hills, or Dorwinion this turn. TAP: cancel a strike (not from an automatic-attack) against himself.

+1 body to all Dwarves in play. Additionally, all Under-deeps movement rolls are modified by adding the number of Dwarves of different descent (one for each type) in the moving company. Cannot be duplicated.

If you have at least three of the four types of battle-gear resources (armor, helmet, shield, or weapon) in play, your battle-gear resources are each worth full MP. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Command. Playable on a Dwarf leader during the organization phase. Return all other command cards on target leader to your hand when this card is played. -2 to leader's DI (to a minimum of 0). All Dwarves in his company receive +1 body, and +2 prowess against non-combat attacks (Trap, Rock Fall, etc.). You may return this card to your hand during any organization phase. Cannot be duplicated in a company.

Dwarf characters (even agents) may be brought into play at any Dwarf-hold where one of your companies is present. Additionally, Balrog of Moria is considered an at home Dragon manifestation for the purpose of Legendary Hoard.
Unique. Helmet. Place this card on Balin if he is in play. +1 body to a maximum of 10. +2 DI against Dwarves. Balin may use Pipe as though he were Gandalf.

Ore. Playable during the site phase at Mines of Falek-dim or The Sulfur-deeps on a Dwarf or on an Orc bearing Miner's Pick. Tap the character. While on the character, make a roll during the untap phase; if the result is less than 5, he must make a body check modified by +2. If target character is at a Haven [H/DH] or Dwarf-hold, he or a sage in the company may tap to place this card with a Dwarven Light-stone, Goblin Earth-plumb or Noldo-lantern in the company. If placed with an item, any bonus the item gives is doubled.

Ritual. Playable after strikes are assigned in CvCC (but before resolving strikes) on a sage in a company at a non-Under-deeps, non-surface site, if Gates of Morning is in play. Tap the sage. All unwounded Trolls at the site are immediately wounded (no body checks are required); if they are Half-troll or Olog-hai, they are tapped instead and receive -2 prowess this turn. Sage makes a CC modified by -2.

Dwarf-lord only. Playable during the site phase on an Under-deeps Ruins & Lairs [R] with a surface site that is not a Shadow-hold [S] or Dark-hold [D]. The company faces an attack: Drake -- 2 strikes with 13 prowess (cannot be cancelled). Following the attack, tap your Dwarf-lord at the site or discard this card. The site becomes one of your protected Lordhavens [H] and a Dwarf-hold and loses all automatic-attacks; it does not leave active play. Nothing is considered playable here as written on the site card. Discard if Invade Their Domain is played on any version of the site.

Warrior only. +4 prowess and -1 body against a strike; -2 to the strike's body. Cannot be played on a wounded character. After the attack, wound the character if not wounded (no body check is required).

Playable at the end of the organization phase on a moving company. If the company uses Under-deeps movement this turn, River cannot be played on the company's new site. Additionally, when The Way Is Shut affects the company, make a roll: if the result is greater than 7, its effects are cancelled. The Reach of Ulmo cancels any ongoing effect of this card.

Ore. Playable at any tapped or untapped Under-deeps site by a Dwarven Miner or Goblin-miner (or any character bearing a Miner's Pick). Discard at a Dwarf-hold to make Reforging playable, or at an Orc-hold to make Dark Forges playable, as if Information were playable there this turn.

Unique. Helmet . Treasure. Playable at a Dragon's lair where an at home Dragon manifestation is in play (or has been defeated), or at Moria if Balrog of Moria is in play (or has been defeated). +1 body. +3 DI against Dwarves. Unless he is a Dwarf, bearer faces an attack during the organization phase by a Dwarf at his site (opponent's choice; considered CvCC between one-character companies). Place a stored Reforging with this item to "restore" it. If restored, values in parentheses apply. TAP: during the organization phase at a Free-hold [F], Border-hold [B], or Ruins & Lairs [R] to bring a Dwarf into play under bearer's DI, which may be taken from your discard pile or hand.

Unique. Dwarf-lord only. Playable on a Dwarf character if he is the highest mind Dwarf in play. Return this card to your hand if a Dwarf with a higher mind is in play. TAP: during your end-of-turn phase to take An Unexpected Party, Dragon-lore, or Dwarven Hoard from your discard pile to your hand.

Unique. Weapon. Axe. Playable at Deep-cleft or any non-Darkhaven Under-deeps site. Warrior only: +2 prowess to a maximum of 9 (+4 against Dwarves to a maximum of 10). Leader only: +2 DI against Orcs. Orc with a mind of 7 or more: TAP: during  strike assignment to allow bearer to face all strikes from a Dwarf attack (in a single strike sequence).

Playable on a character at a Dwarf-hold (not a Dwarf, Wizard, Ringwraith, or overt character). The character receives +2 DI against Dwarves. He suffers no negative modifications due to his race when attempting to influence Dwarf factions. He is also considered a Dwarf for the purpose of non-environment, non-item cards and effects. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Playable on a Dwarf sage or a Dwarf with a mind of six or more at a Dwarf-hold. Target character gains the sage skill. Cannot be duplicated by a given player. TAP: and tap target Dwarf during the organization phase at an untapped Dwarf-hold to play one technology special item with a character at the site. Recipient need not tap to receive this item, which may be taken from your discard pile or hand. Tap the site.

Playable if you have two or more Dwarves in play. Place up to three of the following items under this card from your hand, sideboard, or discard pile when you play this card: Dwarven Chain-shirt, Miner's Pick, or Shield of Iron-bound Ash. Discard this card to place the attached items with characters in your company at a Dwarf-hold (one item per character; discard any unplaced items); you need not tap the characters nor the site.

Command. Playable on a Dwarf leader during the organization phase. -2 to leader's (to a minimum of 0). +1 to all CC by Dwarves in his company bearing a battle-gear item (+2 if a hoard item). You may return this card to your hand during any organization phase. Cannot be duplicated in a company.
Weapon. Warrior only: +2 prowess (to a maximum of 7; +3 prowess if bearer is a Dwarf, to a maximum of 8). If bearer is a minion or overt character, this item gives 3 corruption points.

Armor. Playable at any tapped or untapped site where you have succesfully influenced a Dwarf faction or brought into play a Dwarf character this turn. May also be played during the organization phase (tap the site if untapped). +1 body to a maximum of 8.

As a permanent-event, playable on a site if opponent is not of the same alignment. Tap a Dwarf at the site. The company faces all of the site's automatic-attacks. An additional automatic-attack is created at any other version of the site: Trap -- 3 strikes with 9 prowess. The site does not leave play until this card is discarded. Discard after the associated attack has been faced. Alternatively, playable as a short-event on a Dwarf. Tap the Dwarf to cancel a Trap attack against his company or to discard Concealed Entrance at his site.

Technology. Playable by a Dwarf sage at a tapped or untapped Dwarf-hold. If this item is stored, you may discard it at any time and name a Dwarf-hold you have in play: an additional automatic-attack is created at any version of the site that turn: Lava Flow -- 3 strikes with 9 prowess. Resulting body checks for characters that do not bear any armor, helmet, or shield are modified by +1. Only one Dwarven Fire may be so discarded on a given turn.

Dwarf-lord only. Playable if you have 5 SP or more. Each of your stored To the Uttermost Foundations is worth 2 MP. Cannot be duplicated by a given player. TAP: during your end-of-turn phase to take one Dry Tunnels, Gnawed Ways, Into Dark Tunnels, New Tunnels, or Secret Ways from your discard pile or play deck to your hand.

Dwarf-lord only. You may play a hoard minor item with a company at a Dwarf-hold after the successful play of a resource that taps the site (instead of a 'free' minor item). If this is a starting stage card, your starting minor items may be non-unique hoard minor items.

Unique. Dwarf-lord only. Playable at a tapped or untapped Moria if Reconquest of Khazad-dum is in play (or at Mount Gundabad if Return to Old Dwellings is played on the site), and if the influence check is greater than 14. Standard Modifications: Longbeard Dwarf (+2), Lord of Dwarrowdelf Dwarf (+5).

Playable on a site with Hold Rebuilt and Repaired or Rebuild the Town. Overrides any conflicting hazards and resources. Cannot be duplicated on a site. You may play at the site a faction (not a Dragon or Animal faction) normally playable at a site in the same or adjacent region as target site; the influence attempt is modified by -2. If you have a faction at the site, an additional automatic-attack is created at other versions of the site: same type as the faction -- 3 strikes with 8 prowess (detainment if the company is of the same alignment). Discard during the end-of-turn phase if the site is a Ruins & Lairs [R].

Thrain specific. Playable on Thrain. You suffer no reduction in item MP at the end of the game if these are more than half of your MP total. You may tap a Dwarven Ring Thrain bears to satisfy the hoard requirement for any items played with his company that turn; Thrain makes a CC.

Unique. Dain specific. Playable on Dain during the site phase at Thranduil's Halls. Dain makes a CC modified by -3. Afterwards, tap Dain and make a roll (considered an influence attempt against an Elf; modified by +3 if you have the Wood-elves faction in play), or take this card to hand. If the result is less than 14, discard this card. Otherwise, this card gives 1 item MP for each of your unique factions in play at sites in Wilderland or its adjacent regions (to a maximum of 4).

Food item. Playable by an Orc or Dwarf at any tapped or untapped non-Dark-hold Under-deeps site. If the company moves with Under-deeps movement, discard Fungi at the end of the movement/hazard phase to immediately take another movement/hazard phase; you may untap one character in the company.

Unique. Playable on a staff borne by Gandalf. Discard if the staff is not borne by Gandalf. Gandalf makes a CC when this card taps. TAP: at any time to give +2 to Gandalf's prowess and body against a strike. TAP: during the long-event phase to reduce the hazard limit for Gandalf's company by one (to a minimum of 2) if moving to a new site this turn.
Unique. Playable on a Dwarven Axe borne by Gimli. +1 to Gimli's prowess. You may assign strikes to Gimli regardless of his status. Discard if the Dwarven Axe is not borne by Gimli.

Unique. Dwarf-lord only. Playable on The Gem-deeps if you have a Dwarf-lord there and The Gem-deeps or Glittering Caves is a Haven [H] or Border-hold [B]. You may place any of your Dwarves here "off to the side" with this card. Characters (and cards they control) placed with this card do not give any MP; during the organization phase you may bring them into play at the site. While there is a Dwarf with this card, the site does not leave play. For every two Dwarves placed with it, this card gives 1 faction MP (to a maximum of 4) and the prowess and strikes of all attacks at the site are reduced by 1 (to a minimum of 1).

Place this card on your avatar if he is in play. If this card is on your avatar and you receive any MP for one of the following resources, place it with that resource: Clean the Greenwood, Rescue Prisoners, Into the Smoking Cone, Fate of the Ithil-stone, King under the Mountain, Pass the Doors of Dol Guldur, Reconquest of Khazad-dum, Towers Destroyed, Tower Raided. Cannot be duplicated on a resource. Target resource now gives full MP, and this card gives 1 MP. Discard if target resource is discarded.

Dwarf-lord only. Playable if you have 5 CP or more. You may play Delver's Harvest and Earth-eater at any of your Under-deeps Dwarf-holds (as if at Deep Mines). Additionally, your Gems of Arda, Mithril, Map to Mithril, Vein of Arda, The Arkenstone, and other ore resources in play are each worth full MP. If you have stored at least three different of such cards, this card gives 2 MP. Cannot be duplicated by a player.

Playable during the site phase on Moria, if you have Return to Old Dwellings in play there and a company with a Dwarf majority. The company faces 3 attacks (cannot be cancelled): Orcs -- 5 strikes with 8 prowess; Orcs -- 3 strikes with 11 prowess; Troll -- 1 strike with 14 prowess. Afterwards, tap a Dwarf with mind 5 or more in the company or discard this card. Discard any Invade Their Domain played on Moria. Moria becomes a Border-hold [B]. Discard if Invade Their Domain is played on Moria. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Playable on a Dwarf with a mind of five or more (four or more if a Longbeard). Target character becomes a leader and may tap to untap a Dwarf in his company. You may start the game with this card in lieu of playing a minor item.

Choose one of the following types when you play this card: hoard, ore, ring, or treasure. If you have stored at least three different resources of the chosen type, this card is worth one third of the combined normal MP of these stored resources (round down; to a minimum of 1). Each of your stored resources may only count towards one copy of Hoard Gathering. This card is worth full MP to a Dwarf-lord player.

Each player may take one Wondrous Maps from his sideboard to his hand during the end-of-turn phase. Wondrous Maps can be played if the last region is a Wilderness [w] or a Dark-domain [d]. Cannot be duplicated.

Unique. Playable at Nurunkhizdin, or at Mount Gundabad if Return to Old Dwellings is in play at the site, if the influence check is greater than 11. Standard Modifications: Ironfist Dwarves (+3), Longbeard Dwarves (-3). TAP: make non-unique ore resources playable at the above named sites this turn.

Unique. Armor. Place this card on Dain II if he is in play. +1 body to a maximum of 10. TAP: give Dain +2 prowess against a strike from an Animal, Orc, Spider, or Wolf attack. TAP: during the organization phase to take one Leg It Double Quick from your discard pile to your hand.

Playable on a sage or non-warrior Dwarf at one of your Havens [H] (or in your starting company). Tap target character and a jewel or ore resource in his company, and make a CC: if he is still in play afterwards, one wounded Dwarf in the company may make a body check modified by -2 and (if still in play afterwards) heal from wounded to tapped.

Unique. Helmet. Playable at Goblin-gate. +1 DI against Dwarves. +2 to body to a maximum of 9. Dwarf only: Cancels all dark enchantments targeting the bearer or cards he controls. TAP: give +3 to bearer's prowess against a non-combat attack.

Dwarf-lord only. Playable during the site phase on your Dwarf-lord, if he is at a Dwarf-hold and bears The One Ring. Up to 3 different avatar hazard manifestations which create an attack may now attack his company (resolve separately; cannot be cancelled; one strike of each attack must be assigned to the Dwarf-lord). Opponent may play these from hand, discard pile, or play deck, or use events in play (discard after the attack if not defeated). Afterwards, if your Dwarf-lord is unwounded, make a roll and add 1 for each King of Seven Houses in play. If the result is less than 5, your Dwarf-lord is eliminated; if greater than 8, you win the game. Only one King of Seven Houses may be played per turn. You may return this card to hand during the organization phase.

Playable on a site where you have defeated an at home Dragon or you have Return to Old Dwellings in play. +3 to your GI. The site becomes a Border-hold [B] and a Dwarf-hold. While you have a Dwarf at the site, rotate this card 90deg during your end-of-turn phase. It gives 1 MP for each time rotated (to a maximum of 8), reduced by the number of factions (and cards played on these) opponent has in play at sites in the same territory (or in an adjacent region). Discard if it gives -1 MP or less, or the site is a Ruins & Lairs [R]. It is worth full MP to a Dwarf-lord player. Cannot be duplicated by a player.

Dwarf-lord only. Playable on a Dwarf-lord. If he bears a Dwarven Ring, it is worth full MP, and you may play any ore resources at his non-Haven surface site that are normally playable at its adjacent Under-deeps site. Additionally, you may tap the Dwarven Ring to take one ore resource playable at his site from your discard pile to your hand; the Dwarf-lord makes a CC modified by +2.

Thrain specific. Playable on a Dwarven Ring borne by Thrain. Discard if he does not bear the ring. It gives 2 fewer MP and 2 fewer corruption points. Thrain makes a CC during his untap phase for each other Dwarven Ring in play; if he fails, discard a character in his company (ignore other effects). Cannot be duplicated. As a short-event, playable on Thrain if no Dwarven Ring is in play. +2 prowess, +1 body, +2 DI, and you may keep one more card in your hand this turn; Thrain makes a CC modified by -2. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

Playable during the organization phase on a company with a character controlling Rescue Prisoners. You may bring a character into play with the company, regardless of the company's current site, the presence of an avatar, or the one character per turn limit. The character may be taken from your hand or discard pile.

Unique. Dwarf-lord only. Playable if you have 8 SP or more, on your Dwarf-lord at Moria or one of its adjacent sites. +5 DI against Dwarves. Your Halls of Khazad-dum, Return to Old Dwellings, and Reconquest of Khazad-dum are each worth full MP (if any). Unless Balrog of Moria has been defeated, discard this card if your Dwarf-lord is at a site not in Redhorn Gate or its adjacent regions nor with Moria as adjacent site.

Thranduil of Mirkwood specific. Playable if a treasure or ring is in play. Reveal a treasure item from sideboard and place it face-down with this card. Opponent then places both cards with a Dwarf-hold or site containing a hoard in Wilderland or its adjacent regions; the site may come from any location deck (opponent's choice) and does not leave play while the item is placed with it. Any version of the item may be played by any player at any version of the site. Keep this card with the item; it can only be discarded when the item leaves play, it gives 1MP if stored.

Playable on a company if a character normally worth 2 MP or more has been eliminated from the company this turn (not by a CC). Discard if the company contains fewer than two characters. Store this card when the company is at a Haven [H]; if stored it gives 1 MP. Cannot be duplicated for an eliminated character.
Weapon. +1 prowess to a maximum of 4. +1 to the company's Under-deeps movement rolls. Cannot be used by a Hobbit.

Dwarf-lord only. Playable on a Dwarf-hold, or on a Ruins & Lairs [R] that is an ancient Dwarf-ruin or is in a mountain region. May also be played during the site phase, after any attacks at the site have been faced. The site becomes a Dwarf-hold and one of your Lordhavens [H]. If it already was a Lordhaven, it is protected. Nothing is considered playable as written on the site card. Attacks against your companies here receive -1 to their prowess and strikes (to a minimum of 1). Discard after a Dragon or Spawn attack at the site.

Unique. Manifestation of Gandalf. Playable on a non-overt company without an avatar. You may play spells on the company as if on Gandalf (except True Fana; ignore any required CC). Additionally, when the company moves to a Shadow-hold [S] or Dark-hold [D], after cards are drawn opponent must reveal to you 3 hazards from his hand (or else his whole hand). Discard if you have 10 SP or more, when Gandalf enters play, or you play Sacrifice of Form (place Sacrifice of Form in your MP). Invert this card during your untap phase; if inverted, discard it at the end of your turn.

Dwarf-lord only. If played as a starting stage card, your starting company may include Hobbits. Place this card on your Dwarf-lord if in play. +3 DI against Hobbits. You may play To Fealty Sworn at any site after successfully playing a Dwarf faction there. Additionally, during the organization phase you may bring a Hobbit character into play at his home site from the discard pile, if you tap two Hobbits or four Dwarves in your company at the site. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Unique. Playable at Mines of Angurath if the influence check is greater than 10. Standard Modifications: Dwarves (+3), overt and hero characters (-3), any one Orc faction in play at a site in Mordor or its adjacent regions (-3). This faction gives 4 MP if you have a Dwarven Ring in active play. TAP: take Reforging, Dark Forges, or The Iron-pit from your discard pile to your hand.

Playable on Deep Mines or an Under-deeps Haven [H]. The Way Is Shut does not affect your companies moving to or from this site. You may reveal for a company moving from this site another Deep Mines as new adjacent site (the required movement roll is 0). Place this card with the new Deep Mines site, as well as a surface site from your location deck in the same or an adjacent region as the site of departure's surface site (or two regions away if you discard from play Earth-eater); the attached surface site need not be a protected Wizardhaven and does not leave play until the Deep Mines site leaves play.
Unique. Balin specific. Place this card on Balin if he is in play. Balin may make a CC and (if still in play afterwards) look at a card placed on-guard at his company's site.

Unique. Thorin specific. Playable if you have 10 SP or more, and you receive any MP for Hoard Gathering or have stored at least three major items at Blue Mountain Dwarf-hold. Each of your Dwarves with Blue Mountain Dwarf-hold as a home site receives +1 to his CC and +1 mind; if such a character now has 3 mind, he gives 1 character MP and does not cost any influence to control.

Unique. Shield. Place this card on Thorin II if he is in play. +1 body to a maximum of 10. TAP: allow Thorin to face a strike from an attack against his company, regardless of the attack's normal abilities or his status. TAP: during your end-of-turn phase to take Block from your discard pile to your hand.

All Dwarves in play receive +1 prowess against Orcs (+2 for Longbeards), Trolls, Drakes, and Dragons (+2 for Ironfists). Discard when an attack of these types is defeated by a company with at least one Dwarf. Cannot be duplicated.

Command. Playable on a Dwarf leader during the organization phase. Return all other command cards on target leader to your hand when this card is played. -2 to the leader's DI (to a minimum of 0). +1 prowess to all Dwarves in his company, and +1 to the company's Under-deeps movement rolls. You may return this card to your hand during any organization phase. Cannot be duplicated in a given company.

Hoard item. Treasure. Playable at any tapped or untapped site that contains a hoard. Counts as major item for the purpose of Dragon-sickness. Discard to cancel an attack by Dwarves or Men against the company (or a detainment attack by Elves). Alternatively, discard to give +4 to an influence attempt against a Man or Dwarf character, ally, or faction.

Unless bearer is an Elf, he may tap during the end-of-turn phase and make a CC to bring Longbottom Leaf, Smoke Rings, Pipe Weed, or Old Toby from your discard pile to your play deck and shuffle; if he is Gandalf or Saruman, you may take it into your hand instead.

Playable on a non-Elf character bearing a Pipe or with a home site in Eriador. Tap the character. You may look at the top five cards of your play deck and place them back on top in any order you choose. Character makes a CC (modified by -2 if he is a Hobbit).
Playable on a character. Target character must make a CC for each corruption card he controls; after each successful CC, discard the corruption card. This card may also be played as a hazard.

Cannot be included with a starting company (unless it contains a Hobbit). Discard to cancel any card effect this turn that would return the bearer to your hand (or that would discard him, if bearer is a Hobbit).

Place this card in your MP. Any unique faction you have in play (except Animal, overt, and special factions) may be placed with this card. If there is a faction with this card, additional factions must have been played at different sites in the same or an adjacent region (or in the same territory). This card gives 2 MP if there are at least three factions of different race placed with it.

Playable on a non-avatar Dwarf in your avatar's company (or in your starting company). +1 to his CC and +1 mind. Your Return to Old Dwellings are each worth full MP. Discard if target character transfers an item he controls to another character. Cannot be duplicated on a character.

Unique. Playable at any site in Northern Rhovanion, if the influence check is greater than 8. Standard Modifications: Carc or Roac the Raven is in the company (+3). Longbeard Dwarves and characters with Dale or Lake-town as a home site may play this faction at a tapped site. TAP: give +2 to an influence check against a hero faction playable at a site in Northern Rhovanion, Southern Rhovanion, Dorwinion, or Iron Hills.

Playable if you have Halls of Khazad-dum in play. Balrog players must use the minion version for Moria. Invert this card if one of your companies has defeated a manifestation of Balrog of Moria. If inverted, this card gives 5 MP and all versions of Moria become a Free-hold [F] and a Dwarf-hold; replace its automatic- attacks with: Dwarves -- 4 strikes with 10 prowess (detainment against hero companies; cancelled against your companies). Discard if Halls of Khazad-dum is not in play. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Playable on a hero item that can be stored at a specific site or hold, or that has a race-specific bonus or ability. Target item may be stored at the mentioned site(s), or at a hold of the race for which it gives a bonus or ability; if stored there it gives MP as if borne by a character of the hold's race (even to a Lord-player).

Playable during the site phase on an ancient Dwarf-ruin with an automatic-attack. The company faces all automatic-attacks again, with +2 to prowess and strikes. Then, opponent searches his sideboard, play deck, or discard pile for a creature playable at the site, which attacks the company. None of these attacks can be cancelled. Afterwards, tap a Dwarf at he site or discard this card. Discard any Invade Their Domain in play at the site. The site becomes a Ruins & Lairs [R]. Its automatic-attacks have their number of strikes reduced to one. It does not leave play until this card is discarded. Discard if a minion faction or Invade Their Domain is played at a version of the site. Cannot be duplicated on a site.

Playable on a company at an Under-deeps surface site which is a Dark-hold [D], Shadow-hold [S], or Ruins & Lairs [R]. The company may move an additional region when moving this turn, or discard as many corruption cards as there are strikes in the site's first automatic-attack. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

Unique. Dwarf-lord only. Playable on Thorin III Stonehelm. He becomes a leader. +1 prowess against Men. If Dain II has been eliminated, you may take this card from your sideboard to your hand and Thorin III receives +3 DI. If you are Dain, Thorin III requires 4 points of influence to control and may only be controlled by Dain or GI. TAP: during your end-of-turn phase to take a non-unique Dwarf from your discard pile to your hand.

Unique. Balin specific. If this is a starting stage card, one of your starting minor items may be Share of the Treasure. Place this card on Balin if he is in play. TAP: during your your end-of-turn phase to take one Lord of Dwarrowdelf, Orc-mail, Return to Old Dwellings, or a non-unique Dwarf character from your discard pile to your hand.

Unique. Dain specific. If this is a starting stage card, one of your starting minor items may be Necklace of Silver and Pearls. Place this card on Dain if he is in play. TAP: during your end-of-turn phase to take Kingdom of Old Restored, Mining Settlement, Strength from the Ered Engrin, or a non-unique Dwarf character from your discard pile to your hand.

Unique. Thorin specific. If this is a starting stage card, one of your starting minor items may be Thror's Map. Place this card on Thorin if he is in play. TAP: during your end-of-turn phase to take King under the Mountain, Old Prejudice, Master of Esgaroth, or a non-unique Dwarf character from your discard pile to your hand.

Unique. Thrain specific. If this is a starting stage card, one of your starting minor items may be Lost Tome. Place this card on Thrain if he is in play. TAP: during your end-of-turn phase to take Last of the Seven, Lord of Dwarrowdelf, or Test of Form from your discard pile to your hand.

Dwarf only. Song. Untap all instrument items in the company. Additionally, you may take an instrument item playable at the Dwarf's site from your discard pile to your hand. If the Dwarf is at an ancient Dwarf-ruin and bears an instrument, you may take a Dwarf only or Dwarf-lord only resource (not Songs of the Old) instead.

Unique. Dain specific. Attacks created by Dragon hazard manifestations against your companies at or moving to a site in Wilderland or The Northern Waste receive -1 to their strikes, prowess, and body (to a minimum of 2) for each Dwarf faction you have in play at sites in these territories. Discard when you defeat such a modified attack.

Sage only. Playable during the site phase on a sage at a site where Information is playable. Tap sage and site. The sage gains the warrior skill. If he is already a warrior, he can use two weapons (or a two-handed weapon and a shield; he receives the bonus from both items). If he uses two weapons, he cannot use a shield. Cannot be duplicated on a character.

Unique. Dwarf-lord only. Playable if you have in play at least 7 SP and two non-Longbeard Dwarves of different descent (e.g. Firebeard, Ironfist, etc.). Discard if these conditions do not exist. This card gives 1 MP for each of your Dwarf factions in play. TAP: during your end-of-turn phase to take a Dwarf faction or non-unique Dwarf from your discard pile to your hand.

Unique. Dwarf-lord only. Playable on your Dwarf-lord if you have in play at least: 10 SP, 1 Dwarf faction, The Seven Houses, and 5 Dwarves. +1 to his CC. Invert during the site phase at an ancient Dwarf-ruin if the company has eliminated a manifestation of a Dragon or Spawn creature. If inverted, this card gives 2 MP, and the next influence attempt by your Lord against a Dwarf faction or character, or against an ally or item controlled by a Dwarf, is automatically successful; afterwards, place this card in your MP.
Play when making a riddling roll, to make three rolls modified by -2 and choose one of the results to use. May also be played during opponent's site phase, if a riddling roll is called for.
Playable on a character. Tap character if untapped. +2 to any rolls to remove hazards played on target character (+5 if you discard a food item from the company, for no other effect).
Weapon. Two-handed. Warrior only: +2 prowess to a maximum of 8 (if bearer is a Dwarf, +3 prowess against Trolls to a maximum of 9). When played as a hero resource this item gives 2 MP.

Playable at the end of the organization phase on a moving company with at least two Dwarves. Untap all characters in the company. The company may move an additional region this turn (to a maximum of 6).

NameEN: What Have I Got in my Pocket?
Text: Riddling attempt. Playable during the site phase on a character at the same site as an opponent's company. Tap the character. Opponent chooses a character in his company for this riddling attempt. Each player makes a riddling roll, modified by +2 if his character is a sage and +2 if a Hobbit (re-roll ties). The player with the highest result wins: he names an item (not a unique item in play) and the other player reveals his hand. If the item is revealed, the winner may immediately play a copy of the item with the riddling character taken from sideboard, hand, or discard pile (this does not tap the site); the loser discards the revealed item.
fullCode: What Have I Got in my Pocket? (DF)
normalizedtitle: what have i got in my pocket?
DCpath: DurinsFolk/What Have I Got in My Pocket.jpg

Text: Playable on a company. Any CC made by characters in the company from attempts to play or transfer items, or from storing items or events, are modified by +2 this turn. Cannot be duplicated on a given company on a given turn.

Nearest Haven: Rivendell  Playable: Items (minor, gold ring)  Automatic-attacks: Dwarves -- 3 strikes with 8 prowess (detainment against companies that do not contain an Elf)   Special: Hidden site. Tap a sage in the company to reveal this site. The Petty-dwarves faction is playable at this site. If a Dwarf here discards  a Lost Knowledge card he controls, the site contains a hoard that turn.

Nearest Darkhaven: Carn Dum  Playable: Items (minor, gold ring)  Automatic-attacks: Dwarves -- 3 strikes with 8 prowess (detainment against covert companies that do not contain an Elf)   Special: Hidden site. Tap a sage in the company to reveal this site. The Petty-dwarves faction may be played at this site. If a Dwarf here discards a Lost Knowledge card he controls, the site contains a hoard that turn.

Nearest Haven: Lorien  Playable: Items (minor)  Automatic-attacks: Dwarves -- 2 strikes with 8 prowess (detainment)   Special: Dwarves may play Durang and Reforging at this site; these resources may be stored and used here as if at a Haven [H].

Nearest Darkhaven: Dol Guldur  Playable: Items (minor, major*, gold ring) * --battle-gear items only--   Automatic-attacks: Dwarves -- 3 strikes with 9 prowess   Special: A Dwarf or sage in a covert company here may tap to shuffle an item with 'Dwarven' or 'Dwarf' or in its title or card text from your discard pile or sideboard into your play deck (tap site if untapped).
Playable: Items(minor*, major*, gold ring)   *battle-gear items only

Text: Special: Dwarf-lord only. This site is a protected Lordhaven [H]. If one of your companies is at this site, all attacks against it are cancelled and you receive the SP. Characters with this site as a home site may be brought into play here, regardless of the presence of any other character.

Adjacent Sites: Moria (4), The Under-gates (5)  Playable: Information  Automatic-attacks: Traps -- 2 strikes with 7 prowess   Special: Hidden site. Unless it contains a Dwarf, the company must discard a Lost Knowledge card it controls to reveal this site. Tap a character at the site to take Ancient Stair, Legendary Stair, or The Iron-pit from your sideboard to your hand.

Nearest Haven: Rhubar  Playable: Items (minor, major, gold ring)  Automatic-attacks: Orcs -- 3 strikes with 8 prowess   Special: Ancient Dwarf-ruin. After you have successfully played Tower Raided here, you may take Fortress Reclaimed or Rebuild the Town from your sideboard to your hand.

Nearest Darkhaven: Dol Guldur  Playable: Items (minor, major, gold ring)  Automatic-attacks: Orcs -- 3 strikes with 8 prowess (detainment against overt companies)    Special: Ancient Dwarf-ruin. Non-Nazgul creatures attack normally at this site, not as detainment. An Orc leader may tap during the site phase to discard a Profitable Trade in play with factions in Wilderland (factions remain in play).

Special: Dwarf-lord only. This site is a protected Lordhaven [H]. If one of your companies is at this site, all attacks against it are cancelled and you receive the SP. Characters with this site or Barak-shathur as a home site may be brought into play here, regardless of the presence of any other character.

Nearest Haven: Lorien  Playable: Items (minor, major*)  Automatic-attacks: Undead -- 2 strikes with 7 prowess   Special: Swamp. *Major items are only playable at the site if the company has defeated an Undead attack this turn.

Nearest Darkhaven: Dol Guldur  Playable: Items* (minor)  Automatic-attacks: Undead -- 2 strikes with 7 prowess   Special: Swamp. *Major items are playable at the site if the company has defeated an Undead hazard creature that turn.

Adjacent Sites: Ostigurth (5), The Under-courts (6), any Wondrous Maps in Horse Plains or Nurn (0)  Playable: Items (minor, major, gold ring)  Automatic-attacks: Dwarves -- 4 strikes with 10 prowess (detainment if the company contains a Dwarf majority)   Special: Hidden site. Discard a Lost Knowledge card in the company or tap a sage or avatar to reveal this site. Creatures played at the site attack normally, not as detainment. Contains a hoard.

Adjacent Sites: Gaurblog Lug (0), Nurunkhizdin (7), The Rusted-deeps (8), The Sulfur-deeps (7), The Under-courts (8)  Playable: Items (minor, major, gold ring)  Automatic-attacks (2): (1st) Undead. Dwarves -- 3 strikes with 9 prowess; (2nd) Opponent may play as an automatic-attack one non-unique hazard creature from his hand normally keyed to Shadow-holds [S]  Special: Ancient Dwarf-ruin.

Nearest Haven: Rhubar  Automatic-attacks: Dwarves -- each character faces a strike with 7 prowess (detainment; cancelled if the company contains only Dwarves)   Special: During the organization phase, discard a treasure item from your company here to bring a Dwarf with this site as a home site into play (regardless of his mind); the character may be taken from your hand, discard pile, or play deck.

Nearest Darkhaven: Dol Guldur  Playable: Items (minor, major, gold ring)  Automatic-attacks: *Dwarves -- 4 strikes with 10 prowess (detainment if the company contains a Dwarf)   Special: *You may discard a treasure item from a covert company at this site to cancel this automatic-attack.

Adjacent Sites: Blue Mountain Dwarf-hold (11)*, The Drowning-deeps (11)*  Playable: Items (minor, major, gold ring)  Automatic-attacks (2): (1st) Rock Fall -- 3 strikes with 8 prowess; (2nd) Opponent may play as an automatic-attack one non-unique hazard creature from his hand normally keyed to Shadow-holds [S]  Special: Ancient Dwarf-ruin. *Discard a Lost Knowledge card from a company attempting to move to/from this site to modify their movement roll by +7.

Bears -- 2 strikes with 6 prowess (detainment if the company contains a character with Beorn's House as a home site)   Special: Port-on-Anduin. This site counts as Eagles' Eyrie for the purpose of Eagle-mounts.

Adjacent Sites: Blue Mountain Dwarf-hold (9), The Under-vaults (9), Remains of Thangorodrim (9), Ruins of Belegost (11), Ruins of Nogrod (11)   Playable: Items (minor, major)  Automatic-attacks (2): (1st) Drake -- 2 strikes with 11 prowess; (2nd) Opponent may play as an automatic-attack a non-unique hazard creature from his hand normally keyed to Coastal Seas [c]  Special: Any creature playable keyed to Coastal Seas may be played at this site.

Adjacent Sites: Iron Hill Dwarf-hold (8), Barak-shathur (8), The Wind-deeps (9),  Mines of Falek-dim (8), Ruins of Kheledkhizdin (8), The Cobalt-deeps (8)  Playable: Items (minor, major)  Automatic-attacks (2): (1st) Drake -- 2 strikes with 11 prowess; (2nd) Opponent may play as an automatic-attack one non-unique hazard creature from his hand normally keyed to Shadow-holds [S]  Special: Any Dragon creature playable keyed to a site in Wilderland may be played at this site.

Adjacent Sites: The Wind Throne (0), The Under-leas (6), The Rusted-deeps (9), The Cobalt-deeps (5)   Playable: Items (minor, major)  Automatic-attacks (2): (1st) Orcs -- 3 strikes with 7 prowess; (2nd) Opponent may play as an automatic-attack a non-unique hazard creature from his hand normally keyed to Shadow-holds [S]  Special: Any non-unique Drake creature not playable keyed to a Desert [e] region may be played at this site.

Unique. Grey Agent. +3 DI against Animals and Wolves. Discard if you have Bad Company in play. TAP: cancel an Animal, Spider, or Wolf attack against his company. Agent only: TAP: allow one non-unique Animal or Wolf hazard creature to be played at his Border-hold [B] or Ruins & Lairs [R]; the creature must be keyable to a non-Coastal Sea region by type. Home Site: Buhr Widu, Mountains of Mirkwood

Unique. Black player only. Scara-hai. Leader. +2 DI against Scara-hai. +2 prowess against Elves, Men, Orcs, Animals, Spiders, and Wolves. Cannot use a weapon; when he controls Counterfeit, ignore its normal effects and he may use a weapon. Home Site: Cirith Gorgor, Durthang

Unique. Can use Spirit-magic. Discard a Poisonous Despair from hand to tap a non-avatar, non-Elf character at her site (your choice), or to give a detainment attack against her company -3 prowess; Djerul makes a CC modified by -3. Home Site: Lugarlur, Temple of Lokuthor

Unique. Werewolf. +2 DI against Scara-hai. Can use Shadow-magic and Spirit-magic. Gaurhir is also considered a wolf ally for the purpose of resource events. Counts as The Balrog for the purpose of Fled into Darkness, Glance of Arien, and The Sun Shone Fiercely. Home Site: Durthang, Minas Durlith

+1 prowess against Dwarves. Discard on a body check result of 7. Costs no influence to control if controlled by a leader bearing a Whip. +1 to his company's Under-deeps movement rolls. Home Site: any Orc-hold

Unique. +2 DI against characters and factions playable at sites in Nuriag or its adjacent regions. If you are Sauron, you may discard The Dark Power from hand to make a Man attack against his company detainment. TAP: take Servants in the South and East from your discard pile to your hand. Home Site: Mistrand, Nurniag Camp

Unique. Minion only. Half-troll. Leader. +2 DI against Orcs and Trolls. +2 DI against the Snaga-hai faction; she may play this faction at any Dark-hold [D]. TAP: bring Hold Rebuilt and Repaired or Snaga-hai from your sideboard or discard pile to your play deck and shuffle.  Home Site: Barad-wath, Mines of Angurath

Unique. Uruk-hai. Leader. Discard on a body check result of 8. +2 DI against Orcs. +1 prowess against Dwarves and Men. If Great Army of the North is in play, Hurog's followers receive +1 to their CC; if you receive MP for it, any non-unique Orc hazard creature is playable keyed to his region.  Home Site: Deep Cleft, Mount Gundabad

Unique. Can use Spirit-magic. + 1 DI against characters and factions playable at his home site. Non-unique Half-orc characters are playable with Leardinoth at his home site. Home Site: Dol Guldur, Strayhold

May be brought into play at any Orc-hold if an overt leader is at the site. Discard on a body check result of 7. TAP: play Hail of Darts on his company regardless of the phase; all Orc Archers in the company receive +1 to their prowess and body this turn. TAP: give one strike from an attack (or in CvCC) -1 CC to its prowess and body. Home Site: any Dark-hold

Discard on a body check result of 9. If there are at least two other Orcs in his company, his prowess and body are modified by -1 (instead of -3) when not tapping to face a strike.  Home Site: any Orc-hold

Can use spirit-magic. +1 DI if he controls a trophy. You may eliminate a trophy in the company or a prisoner he controls to heal an Orc or Troll in the company (from wounded to tapped; tap Orc Shaman if untapped). Cannot be duplicated by a player unless he has a unique Orc faction in play for each Orc Shaman. Home Site: any Orc-hold

Agent. May come into play at any Border-hold [B]. Any company moving to his site has its hazard limit increased by one. Agent only: when he is face-up and attacks, you can choose for the attack to be at +2 prowess and detainment: if any of its strikes are successful, the company must store one Lost Kowledge, Stolen Knowledge, or Information card it controls (defender's choice). Home Site: Bree, Strayhold, Umbar

Unique. Uruk-hai. Leader. Discard on a body check result of 8. +2 DI against Orcs and Trolls. +2 prowess against Orcs. His company may normally move only three regions. If a strike against Ukog in CvCC fails and he is untapped, the resulting body check is modified by +2 (tap Ukog). Home Site: Sarn Goriwing

Unique. Agent. TAP: take one Old Cache or Swag from your discard pile to your hand. Agent only: TAP: when he attacks during the site phase to play Ransom on a strike from the attack.       Home Site: Mistrand, Raider-hold, Strayhold

Unique. +2 DI against the Rivermen of the Anduin Vales faction. Discard a Bridge, Down the Hurrying Waters, or Forced March from hand to cancel a River or Enchanted Stream played against his company before it resolves. TAP: bring one of the above named resources from your discard pile to your play deck and shuffle. Home Site: Mathlaburg

Unique. Scara-hai. Discard on a body check result of 7 or 8. TAP: during the site phase at an Orc-hold, if Host of Bats is in play or Swarm of Bats is played on his company, to play one Poison, which may be taken from your discard pile or hand (tap the site if untapped).  Home Site: Durthang

Unique. +2 DI against characters and factions playable at sites in Western Mirkwood, Heart of Mirkwood, or Woodland Realm. If he is at such a site, you may play Widuskapin Ritual there. -1 to his CC if his company is overt.  Home Site: any site in Western Mirkwood

Unique. Agent. Can use Sorcery. +1 DI against characters and factions playable at sites in Wilderland for each Cult of the Long Night in play. Agent only: TAP: if at a Man-hold in Wilderland to take Brigands from your discard pile to your hand. Home Site: Mistrand, Riavod, Strayhold

Unique. Discard on a body check result of 8. +1 DI against Orcs. If he bears a Whip, Zurtak becomes a leader; he may tap to untap an Orc in his company. If you are Sauron, he receives +1 to his mind, prowess, body, and CC.  Home Site: Ostigurth, Urlurtsu Nurn

Playable on a hazard creature attack by Orcs, Trolls, Dwarves, Dunedain, Elves, or Men, against a moving company that has not faced an attack this phase; the attack must be able to wound a defending character; does not count against the hazard limit. Attacker chooses defending characters for the attack.

Environment. Whenever an environment hazard or magic resource is played, add one token to one of your Arda Marred in play (your choice). Discard 2 tokens from this card to play a hazard creature not counting against the hazard limit. If there are 4 or more tokens on this card, you may discard it (at any time) to cancel an action by your opponent that allows him to take a resource from his discard pile or sideboard.

Drake. Two strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. May be played keyed to Ered Lithui, Gorgoroth, Nurn, and Udun; and at any volcano site. May also be played keyed to a region affected by Awaken the Earth's Fire. If Drought is in play, may also be played keyed to Khand, Chelkar, and their adjacent regions.

Playable on a scout or ranger agent. If he is at an opponent's company's current or new site, the agent may tap to reveal two random cards from opponent's hand; if he is at such a site during the untap phase, opponent reveals 5 cards (agent need not tap) and the agent may move up to 3 regions when moving that turn. Discard after an attack or influence attempt by the agent. Cannot be duplicated on an agent.

Vermin. Animals. 20 strikes. Playable if Doors of Night is not in play. Detainment. May be played keyed to Anduin Vales, Beorn's House, Rhosgobel, The Carrock, and Ligr Wodaize Berne. May not be played against a company containing a character with one of these sites as a home site. May also be played as a resource short-event by such a character when CvCC is declared (during any turn; before strikes are assigned): opponent's company now faces an attack by Beijabar Bees.
All resource effects that modify the MP of an item, ally, faction, or character to give more than its normal MP (as listed on their card) are cancelled. Cannot be duplicated.

Playable on a leader. +1 to opponent's SP. Whenever a command card is played on the leader, or a roll is made for a command card he controls, opponent makes a body check for another character in the company (defender's choice). Cannot be duplicated on a leader.

Unique. Demon. Wolf. One strike. As a creature, may be played keyed to Southern Mirkwood, Dol Guldur, and The Sulfur-deeps. Any body check resulting from the attack is modified by +1 (unless the defending character bears any armor, helmet, or shield). As a short-event, one Wolf hazard creature may be played keyed to a Border-hold [B] this phase.

Each player may take one Angmar Arises, In Darkness Bind Them, Reaching Shadow, In the Grip of Ambition, or Webs of Fear and Treachery from his sideboard or discard pile to his hand during the end-of-turn phase. Additionally, prevents the discarding of any non-environment long-events when The Will of Sauron is discarded.

TAP: if a site in Angmar, Mirkwood, or Mordor is in play to take one Awaken Denizens or Awaken Minions from your discard pile or sideboard to your hand. If there are two such sites in play, you may take Eyes of the Shadow or The Enemy Is Watching instead; or Times Are Evil if there are three, or The Will of Sauron if there are four such sites in play.This card never untaps.

Disease. Playable on a non-Elf, non-avatar character after a successful strike from a Vermin attack this phase, if Doors of Night or Ill East Wind is in play. The character receives -1 prowess. At the beginning of each of his untap phases he makes a body check modified by -2; unless he was already wounded, failing this check only wounds the character. Any effect that would heal the character removes this card instead.

TAP: during the movement/hazard phase of a non-moving company, to make a roll and add the mind of each character in that company; if the result is greater than 12, you may take a hazard from your sideboard to your hand. This card does not untap normally; instead, during opponent's long-event phase, tap your Power Built by Waiting or discard An Unexpected Outpost from hand to untap it. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Playable if you tap a non-warrior agent. You may have and/or move one agent at/to a site where another of your face-up agents is located, without using a site from the location deck. Cannot be duplicated by a given player. TAP: if Saruman, The Lidless Eye, or Near to Hear a Whisper is in play, to untap or turn face-down one of your agents.

Playable on a leader. Command cards cannot be played on target leader. Any roll for a command he controls, or to remove Rebel-talk or Shut Yer Mouth in his company, is modified by -2. Additionally, opponent receives 1 SP. If he has 5 SP or more, any of his GI not useable to control characters is reduced to 0. Discard when his company defeats a creature attack or any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated on a leader.

Playable on a non-Ringwraith leader. Make a roll and add opponent's SP total; if the result is greater than 7, discard one No More Nonsense, By the Ringwraith's Word, Obey Him or Die, Orders from Lugburz, Orders from the Great Demon, or command card the leader controls (defender's choice).

Playable on a non-unique creature in your opponent's MP or your out-of-play pile, if it was defeated this phase. Make a roll for the creature: if the result is greater than its normal MP plus 5, shuffle it into your play deck and remove this card from the game.

Unique. Troll. May also be played at Dol Guldur or following an Orc or Troll attack at a Shadow-hold [S] this phase. When Gorfaur the Lame is revealed or played, all characters in the company receive -1 to their prowess and CC this phase.

All swamps and sites with an Orc automatic-attack gain an additional automatic-attack: Vermin -- 7 strikes with 4 prowess. Any wounded non-overt, non-avatar character facing a strike from this attack must make a body check modified by -2. Discard when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated.

Vermin. Animals. May be played at any swamp or oasis, or against a company that has faced River or Enchanted Stream this turn. Detainment. Each character faces one strike. For one successful strike by Leeches, a Death-carrying Vermin may immediately be played on the defending character, which may be taken from your discard pile or hand. If no strike of the attack is successful, Leeches are defeated.

Corruption. Playable on a non-Ringwraith character who can use sorcery, spirit-magic, or shadow-magic. Target character makes a CC each time a character in his company uses a magic resource. During his organization phase, the character may tap to attempt to remove this card by making a roll -- if the result is greater than 6, discard this card. Cannot be duplicated on a character.

Any character controlling a prisoner must be assigned a strike from any hazard creature attack against his company, regardless of his status; if such a strike is successful, the prisoner is not released but discarded (then discard this card).

Unique. Playable on an avatar if your opponent has more than six characters or more than two companies in play. Tap the avatar if untapped. The next time he would untap, remove this card from the game instead.

Men. Five strikes. (detainment against hero and covert companies). May be played keyed to Anduin Vales or any region in Mirkwood; and at non-Haven sites in these regions. A character with a home site in these regions may tap to cancel this attack. Unless the attack was cancelled or defeated, resources that require a scout or ranger in target company cannot be played this turn.

Vermin. Animals. Detainment. 20 strikes. May also be played at any swamp, or keyed to a magic-using minion character's region, if you control the magic-user. Each defending character cannot be assigned more excess strikes from this attack than his body value.

Environment. Nurn is also considered a Coastal Sea [c] region for the purpose of playing non-unique hazards. If The Reach of Ulmo is in play, this card is not discarded during opponent's long-event phase.

Nazgul hazard creatures may be played keyed to any region that contains a Dark-hold [D], or contains a Shadow-hold [S] or Ruins & Lairs [R] where a unique minion faction is in play. Cannot be duplicated by a player. TAP: and discard this card to take In Great Wrath or Out of the Black Sky from your discard pile or sideboard to your hand.

Orcs. Three strikes. May also be played keyed to any region containing a Dark-hold [D]; and to its adjacent regions if the company has faced Orc-patrol or Orc-raiders this turn. Orc-battalion receives +1 prowess and strikes for every two characters in the defending company. If Orc-battalion is keyed to a Dark-domain [d] or Dark-hold [D], its attack cannot be cancelled by resource events (except magic or spells).

Playable on a character in a company with a Lord or Fallen-wizard. Discard one Trusted Counsellor, Thrall of the Voice, or Wizard's Myrmidon the character controls, or a Sworn to the Lord the avatar controls (defender's choice). During the organization phase, target character must be controlled by GI or leave the avatar's company. Discard if target is not in a company with an avatar. Cannot be duplicated on a character.

Unique. Playable on Carn Dum, Dol Guldur, or a Dark-hold [D] in Mordor (even your own site) if The Lidless Eye is in play. Any company entering a version of the site faces an attack (cannot be cancelled by using a ring): Fallen-maia -- 1 strike with 20 prowess (detainment against minion companies); any character wounded is eliminated. Discard when the attack is defeated. TAP: make this card a long-event. This card never untaps. Each hero company at or moving to the site has its hazard limit increased by 2 and each character in such a company his CC modified by -1.

Playable on a non-overt character facing a strike from a non-automatic Man or Slayer attack; the strike must be able to force a body check. If the strike is successful, the character is not wounded but taken prisoner at a Border-hold [B], Ruins & Lairs [R], or Shadow-hold [S]. Rescue-attack: Men -- 3 strikes with 8 prowess.

Corruption. Playable on a character bearing a ring. The character receives 2 corruption points and makes a CC at the end of each of his phases if he does not bear a ring. During his organization phase, if the character does not bear a ring, he may tap to attempt to remove this card by making a roll -- if the result is greater than 6, discard this card. Cannot be duplicated on a character.

Playable on an agent (not a grey agent). Target agent may tap to make Nazgul hazard creatures playable at his Border-hold [B] or Ruins & Lairs [R] this turn; afterwards, return him to his home site. Discard if the agent is wounded or turned face-down. Cannot be duplicated on an agent.

Unique. Demon. May be played at Dol Guldur and Sarn Goriwing. Attacker chooses defending characters. May also be played following a Nazgul attack keyed to Brown Lands or a region of Mirkwood this phase; and to such a region or at non-Free-hold sites therein if Reaching Shadow is in play. Instead of making a body check for a character wounded by Slyardach, you may place a Black Breath with him, which may be taken from your hand or discard pile.

Each non-unique Orc hazard creature that normally has three or more strikes receives +1 strike (+2 if Shadow of Mordor is in play); and it may be played keyed to Dark-domains [d] and at Orc-holds. Discard during the end-of-turn phase if an Orc hazard creature was defeated that turn. Cannot be duplicated.

Playable on a face-up agent (in play by any player). The agent must return to one of his home sites (controlling player's choice), or be taken back to hand (along with any cards he controls) if none of his home sites are available.

The total kill MP any player receives cannot be more than half his total MP (or half his total MP for a Fallen-wizard; round down). TAP: place this card with a defeated creature or character in opponent's MP; target now gives half its normal kill MP (round down). This card may always be the target of resource events.

Corruption. Disease. Playable on a non-Elf, non-avatar character. Target character makes a CC modified by -1 whenever his company faces a Spider or Vermin attack.During his organization phase, the character may tap to attempt to remove this card by making a roll -- if the result is greater than 6, discard this card. Cannot be duplicated on a character.

Unique. Disease. Each character in play controlling a disease makes a body check. Unless he was already wounded, failing this body check only wounds the character. Alternatively, play to take up to two disease cards from your discard pile to your hand.

The number of cards revealed for Aware of their Ways is increased by two. Additionally, when cards are revealed from the resource player's hand or play deck during the movement/hazard phase, the hazard player may choose an effect based on the number of cards revealed: one or more, the hazard limit is increased by one; two or more, the hazard player may bring a hazard from his sideboard or discard pile  to his play deck; three or more, one of the revealed cards is discarded at random. Cannot be duplicated.

Playable on a detainment attack created by an agent or a non-unique Dunadan, Dwarf, Hobbit, Man, or Wose creature, before strikes are assigned. The attack becomes a normal attack; any strikes that must still be resolved after the first successful strike of the attack become detainment again. If the attack is      defeated, place this card with the creature (or agent) in opponent's MP.
Environment. Each player's hand size is reduced by one (by two if Morgul Night is in play). If Skies of Fire is in play, each minion player's hand size is increased by one. Cannot be duplicated.

Demon. Flying. Attacker chooses defending characters. May also be played against a company that has faced a Nazgul or Spawn attack this turn. Only one Vampire can be played in a given phase. The defending player must reveal two random cards from his hand for each successful strike of the attack.

Men. Five strikes. Playable keyed to Chelkar, Khand, Horse Plains, and Nuriag; and to any adjacent regions if Uvatha the Horseman or Doors of Night is in play. A character with a home site in these regions may tap to cancel this attack. If two or more strikes of the attack are successful, one horse or animal ally in the company must be discarded (defender's choice).

Demon. Wolf. One strike. May also be played at a Ruins & Lairs [R] that has at least three Wildernesses [w] in its site path. Unless the defending character bears any armor, shield, or helmet, any resulting body check he makes is modified by +1. Only one Werewolf can be played in a given phase.
Path: w w w s s d

Text: Any Nazgul hazard creature may be played against a company that has faced a Nazgul attack that phase; discard at the end of the phase if a Nazgul creature attacked in this fashion. Cannot be duplicated. Additionally, Words of Power and Terror played on a company facing a Nazgul attack also taps one non-avatar, non-Elf character or ally in the company (hazard player's choice).
Harondor, Haruzan, Khand, Pezarsan
Mountain Region. Dagorlad, Gorgoroth, Horse Plains, Nuriag, Nurn, Udun
Barl Syrnac, Dorwinion, Dyr, Harrhun, Iron Hills, Kykurian Kyn, Lhugdalf, Lotan, N. Rhovanion, Talath O., Taur Romen, Withered Heath
Forrhun, Horse Plains, Kykurian Kyn, Nuriag, Relmether, Sea of Rhun, Taur Romen

Playable on your starting company in lieu of playing a minor item. The company may contain two Orc leaders. Unique Orc leaders in the company receive +3 DI against Orcs; you may start the game at one of their home sites. Discard if you have an avatar in play, or if the company contains more than two unique leaders, a non-Orc leader, or more than two non-Orc characters. Cannot be duplicated by a given player. TAP: bring one resource or character from your sideboard to your play deck (or three to your discard pile).

Minion only. Playable on a Darkhaven [K] or Dark-hold [D]. Characters at the site may transfer any allies they control to other characters in the company with an equal or greater mind (or to an avatar or a Ringwraith). If the ally is non-unique, the new controlling character may not already control such an ally.

Prisoner. Minion only. Playable during CvCC if your company contains at least twice as many characters as opponent's company. Instead of making a body check for one of opponent's non-avatar characters, place him with this card under control of a character in your company that taps: target character is taken prisoner with the company. This card gives 1 MP if the prisoner is stored. Discard at the end of the turn if no prisoner is placed with it.

Spirit Ring. Playable only with a gold ring and after a test indicates a Spirit Ring. -2 to bearer's mind (to a minimum of 1). Cannot be duplicated on a given character. TAP: discard a hazard permanent-event played on the company or an entity therein. Bearer makes a CC.

Unique. Instrument. Playable only by Adunaphel the Ringwraith at any site in The Sun-lands (does not tap the site). This item only affects Adunaphel; she gains the sage skill and need not be taken to hand on a body check result of 7 or 8. Unless in Fell Rider mode, one Ringwraith follower is not considered in her company for the purpose of resource short-events. TAP: during the end-of-turn phase to take Heralded Lord, Morgul-apprentice, or No Escape from My Magic from your discard pile to your hand.

Black player only. Place this card on Adunaphel the Ringwraith if in play as your Ringwraith. You may play this card in lieu of a minor item in your starting company and start the game at Lugarlur; Adunaphel gains this site as a home site. If on Adunaphel, she becomes a Warlord and a leader. Your Dunadan characters cost one fewer influence to control. Discard this card to take Adunaphel's Lute from your discard pile to your hand. Cannot be duplicated.

Sage only. Playable during the site phase on a site with an Undead automatic-attack. Tap the sage. The site loses all its Undead automatic-attacks. If the site is a Ruins & Lairs [R], it contains a hoard. Sage makes a CC modified by -2. Discard when you play an item at the site.

Unique. Helmet. Playable only by Uvatha the Ringwraith at any site in Khand, Nuriag, or region adjacent to these (does not tap the site). This item only affects Uvatha; he can use shadow-magic and need not be taken back to hand on a body check result of 7 or 8. TAP: instead of Uvatha whenever a card is played on (or against) him or his company that requires a scout or ranger to tap.

Unique. Spirit Ring. Playable with a gold ring and only after a test indicates a Spirit Ring. Bearer makes a CC each time this card untaps. TAP: give the bearer warrior, scout, ranger, sage, or diplomat skill this turn (choose one). TAP: increase your hand size by one this turn. TAP: take Origins Revealed, Raised Again, or Wisdom to Wield from your discard pile to your hand.

Horse. Playable at any tapped or untapped Border-hold [B] in Mordor or its adjacent regions. Discard if controlled by an overt character. If each character in the company controls a horse ally, the company may move up to 2 additional regions. If each Ringwraith controls a Black Steed or Black Horse, the company is in Black Rider mode; return its controlling Ringwraith to your hand if this ally leaves play. TAP: cancel a strike (not from an automatic-attack) against its bearer or itself.

Magic. Sorcery. Playable on a Ringwraith. If a strike against the Ringwraith in CvCC has failed and The Fiery Blade or Morgul-blade was discarded as a result, you may place this card with the defeated character, together with one Morgul-knife, The Pale Sword, or Wound of Long Burden from hand. The attached hazard cannot be removed by resource effects. If the character is eliminated, you receive him as kill MP. Discard if the attached hazard leaves play. Cannot be duplicated on a character.

Unique. Hoard item. Weapon. Two-handed. Mace. May not be borne by a Hobbit. Warrior only: +2 prowess to a maximum of 10 (+4 against Dunedain and Men). Troll only: TAP: reduce the number of strikes from an Elf, Dwarf, Dunadan, or Man attack by one (to a minimum of 1). If bearer is Rogrog, he may tap to untap this item.

Unique. Sauron only. Demon. Playable at Minas Durlith. May use shadow-magic and spirit-magic. When he is at Barad-dur or Minas Durlith, Bolvag may attempt to influence factions playable there as if he were a character, and you may eliminate an Orc in his company to untap the site. Unless The Ongrum is in the company, discard Bolvag if he moves to a site not in Mordor nor with a surface site in Mordor.

Unique. Only playable if the company has faced an Orc attack this turn. Weapon. Mace. Two-handed. Warrior only: +2 prowess (+4 if Doors of Night is in play) to a maximum of 10; -2 to target's body. TAP: when CvCC is declared to tap a character in opponent's company or reduce the number of excess strikes against your company by 2.

Command. Playable on a Warlord. Cannot be duplicated by a given player. TAP: during the organization phase to make a roll and add your SP total; if the result is greater than 7, bring a non-unique character playable at the Warlord's site into play, which may be taken from your discard pile or hand (and in addition to another character played this turn).

Command. Playable on a Warlord. Cannot be duplicated by a given player. Discard this card to untap a faction you have in play at the Warlord's site. TAP: make a roll and add your SP total; if  the result is greater than 6, take a faction playable at the Warlord's site from your discard pile to your hand.

Command. Playable on a leader in a company with an avatar or Warlord; may also be played on a leader in your starting company in lieu of a minor item or starting stage card. Target character is not considered a leader. Discard any other command cards he controls. He receives -1 to his mind and +1 to his CC. His DI is reduced to 0 and he may not have any followers. You may discard this card if the character is in a company with an avatar or Warlord. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Unique. Mind Ring. Playable only by The Grimburgoth at any site in Mirkwood or its adjacent regions where gold rings are playable (or by any character if Khamul the Easterling is in play). +2 to bearer's CC for using a magic resource. +2 prowess against ringbearers. When the company defeats a creature attack while a sorcery card was used facing the attack or a strike, place the defeated creature with this item. For every two creatures placed with it, all creature attacks against the company receive -1 to their prowess and body.

Magic. Sorcery. Playable on a sorcery-using character facing an attack (before strikes are assigned). For each weapon in the company you may assign one strike of the attack to the sorcery-using character, regardless of his status or the attack's abilities. Each strike must be resolved separately. The prowess and body of such a strike are modified by subtracting any bonus the corresponding weapon would give its bearer against it. The sorcery-using character makes a CC modified by -4. Cannot be duplicated for a given attack.

Playable when making an influence attempt against a Dragon faction. Place a unique hero item the company contains (not The One Ring or Bilbo's Magic Ring) in your out-of-play pile. The influence attempt is modified by the number the removed item would give as if discarded for the attempt (a special item counts as greater item). If the influence attempt was successful and you are not a Dragon-lord, place this card in your MP.

Quest. Playable in lieu of playing a minor item with a starting company; any player may bring Contested Powers of Mirkwood into play from their sideboard. Cannot be duplicated by a player. Tap a unique faction you have in play at a site in Mirkwood or its adjacent regions to take Clean the Greenwood, Pass the Doors of Dol Guldur, Towers Destroyed, or a Stolen Knowledge card from your sideboard to your hand; then flip this card.

Quest. Playable in lieu of playing a minor item with a starting company; any player may bring Contested Powers of Mirkwood into play from their sideboard. Cannot be duplicated by a player. Tap a unique faction you have in play at a site in Mirkwood or its adjacent regions to take one Smoke on the Wind, Burning Rick, Cot, and Tree, or a Stolen Knowledge resource from your sideboard to your hand; then flip this card.

Playable on Thong of Fire, Whip, or Whip of Many Thongs. May be played with your starting company in lieu of a minor item. If the bearer of target item is a leader, during the organization phase you may tap it and make a body check modified by -1 for another character in his company; if still in play afterwards, that character may untap and his company may move an extra region that turn. Cannot be duplicated on an item.

Place this card on your Ringwraith if he is in play. His company may move (using region movement) to any site in the same region as his home site. When moving to such a site, Bade to Rule is not discarded as per its card text. While at his home site, your Ringwraith is considered at a Darkhaven [K] for the purpose of Bade to Rule, Black Rider, and Heralded Lord, and for using any of his abilities. You may start the game with this card in lieu of playing a minor item.

Black player only. Cult. Playable on a Man-hold in Mordor, Bay of Ormal, The Sun-lands, or the Great Central Plains, where you have a unique faction in play. Eliminate one of your non-Ringwraith characters at the site (or a prisoner in the company). The site becomes one of your Darkhavens [K] and loses all its automatic-attacks; automatic-attacks at other versions of the site become normal attacks. Discard if you do not have a unique faction in play at the site. Cannot be duplicated on a site.

Cult. Playable on a sage at Nan Morsereg if you eliminate a trophy or prisoner in the company. While Doors of Night is in play, the sage gains +1 prowess, +1 body, and +1 to his CC from using magic resources. He may tap to bring Peril Returned into play from your sideboard. If there is more than one copy of Cult of the Long Night in play, this card gives 1 faction MP. Cannot be duplicated on a character.

Black player only. Prisoner. Playable on Stinker at Barad-dur or Dol Guldur. Place Stinker and this card "off to the side": he is considered a prisoner at the site. Each of his untap phases, make a body check for Stinker modified by +1. Afterwards, if still in play, you may discard him to take My Precious from your discard pile or play deck to your hand. If eliminated, place this card in your MP:it gives 2 ally MP and your ring test are modified by +1 (+3 if at Bag End).

Black player only. Playable on a non-overt diplomat. The diplomat may use In the Name of Mordor to cancel a detainment attack of the same type as his race against the company. If he controls Faithless Steward, he need not tap to use In the Name of Mordor. If an automatic-attack was thus cancelled, any influence attempt at the site that turn is modified by +3.

Sage only during the site phase at an untapped site where Information is playable. Tap the sage and the site. Sage may not untap until this card is stored at a Darkhaven [K]. During the organization phase, tap a sage at a Darkhaven and discard a stored Dark Forges to retrieve one or two minor or major battle-gear items or technology items from your discard pile (not a unique, hoard, or dual item). These must be placed under control of characters in the sage's company.

Barad-dur does not leave active play. During the site phase at Barad-dur, tap three characters with each a different skill and play Hold Rebuilt and Repaired (regardless of the site's type) to invert this card; flip Mordor in Ruins (if in play). Only one copy of this card can be inverted. If inverted, it gives 3 MP. Barad-dur becomes a Dark-hold [K]. If you are The Necromancer, replace it with The Lidless Eye or Sauron, which may be taken from your sideboard or hand. Re-invert this card if Barad-dur is not a Dark-hold.

Unique. During their organization phase, any player may discard a mode event from his Ringwraith's company and replace it with another mode event, which may be taken from their hand or sideboard. If Morgul Night or Skies of Fire is in play, discard this card to heal a Ringwraith (from wounded to untapped) or allow his company to use region movement this turn.

Minion only. This phase, each of your avatar or magic-using characters may tap to cancel a Maia or Elf attack against his company, or to cancel the play of an Elf or Maia hazard event or of a spell at his site (before it resolves). Alternatively, may be played as a hazard on a spell (before it resolves): make a roll -- if the result is greater than 6, the spell  is cancelled.

Black player only. Place this card on Dwar the Ringwraith if in play as your Ringwraith. You may start the game with this card in lieu of playing a minor item. Dwar may come into play at any site with a Wolf automatic-attack. If on Dwar, he becomes a Warlord and a leader. You may assign strikes to wolf allies in his company regardless of their status. Discard this card to take Ge of Ogamur from your discard pile to your hand. Cannot be duplicated.

Quest. Playable in lieu of playing a minor item with a starting company; any player may bring Dragon Marked in Red into play from their sideboard. Cannot be duplicated by a player. When you play a unique or hoard item at a site in Withered Heath or its adjacent regions, you may take one Information resource, unique Dragon manifestation, or hoard minor item from your sideboard to your hand; then flip this card.

Quest. Playable in lieu of playing a minor item with a starting company; any player may bring Dragon Marked in Red into play from their sideboard. Cannot be duplicated by a player.
