When you play a unique or hoard item at a site in Withered Heath or its adjacent regions, you may take an Information resource, hoard minor item, or unique Dragon manifestation from your sideboard to your hand; then flip this card.

Unique. Helmet. Playable by Khamul the Ringwraith at any site in Wilderland or the Great Central Plains (does not tap the site). This item only affects Khamul; he gains the scout skill and need not be taken back to hand on a body check result of 7 or 8. +2 prowess against Dragons and Drakes. Any gold ring is considered playable with Khamul's company at sites where gold rings are playable. TAP: shuffle any Black Rain into your play deck instead of discarding it from play this phase.

Playable on Dol Guldur. Your rolls for Breeder's Stock at the site are automatically successful. You may play items stored here during the organization phase (as if during the site phase). If your Warlord is at Dol Guldur and this card is discarded, you may untap him or take one Drums or a command card from your sideboard to your hand. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Stolen Knowledge. Playable on a Dwarf, Elf, or Dunadan at the same site as opponent's Return of the King Aragorn II, The Elf-king Elf, or Lord of Dwarrowdelf -or King under the Mountain Dwarf; may also be played on one of your face-up agents. While he is at the same site as one of the above named characters: Information is considered playable at the site, and all of opponent's influence attempts at the site are modified by -3. Cannot be duplicated on a character.
Instrument. TAP: take Tribal Banner or a command card from your discard pile to your hand. TAP: make one non-unique Troll ally playable at the company's untapped Shadow-hold [S] Orc-hold this turn.

Black player only. Playable on your Ringwraith at Barad-dur or Dol Guldur, if you receive more MP from unique items and killed creatures than your opponent. Your Ringwraith becomes a Warlord and a leader and receives +3 DI. He may use Threats as if he were a warrior, and also for any influence attempt (as if influencing a faction). Discard if opponent plays Favoured by The Eye. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Unique. Undead. Playable at a site in Dagorlad by a magic-using character bearing a mind ring. Cannot be played by a Lord-player. Can use shadow-magic. Feagwath's company is always overt. All characters in the company receive -1 to their CC. TAP: cancel an Undead attack against his company or take Gold Chains in the Wind from your discard pile to your hand.

TAP: modify the prowess of an Animal, Wolf, Spider, or Awakened Plant attack against the company by -2. Alternatively, a ranger bearer may tap this item to cancel a non-automatic Awakened Plant attack against his company.

Quest. Black player only. Playable in lieu of playing a minor item with a starting company. Bring Mordor in Ruins into play from your sideboard (if not in play). During the site phase at Barad-dur, tap three characters with each a different skill and play Hold Rebuilt and Repaired (regardless of the site's type) to flip this card. Cannot be duplicated by a player.

Sauron only. Stolen Knowledge. Tap your character at the same site as an opponent's company and place this card with that company; you may take Eye of Sauron from your sideboard or discard pile to your hand. Cannot be duplicated on a company. This card affects opponent's company: their hazard limit is increased by one and each character receives -1 to his CC. When the company moves, make a roll at the end of their hazard phase, adding 1 for each ranger and 1 for each region moved in. If the result is greater than 12, store this card: it gives 1 MP.

Unique. Weapon. Playable by Dwar the Ringwraith at any site in Udun, the Great Central Plains, or region adjacent to these (does not tap the site). This item only affects Dwar; he may use spirit-magic and need not be taken to hand on a body check result of 7 or 8. Attacks from your Hounds of Sauron receive +1 to their prowess and strikes. TAP: shuffle any Our Own Wolves into your play deck instead of discarding it from play this phase.

Whenever you defeat a Dragon attack, rotate this card 90deg and rotate any Use with Terrible Effect in play back 90deg. For each time rotated, Dragon and Drake attacks against your companies receive -1 to their prowess. If fully rotated, this card gives 2 MP, and you suffer no reduction in item MP if those are more than half of your total MP at the end of the game.

Playable on a non-overt, non-Ringwraith company facing automatic-attacks at a Border-hold [B] or Free-hold [F]. Make a roll and add one for each scout in the company. If the result is greater than 8, cancel one automatic-attack at the site. If all automatic-attacks are thus cancelled, Seize Prisoners and Stabbed Him in His Sleep are playable at the site this turn even if it is untapped (afterwards tap site if untapped).

Unique. Flying. Playable at Mountains of Mirkwood, if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: none. Cannot be influenced by a character in an overt company. TAP: cancel an attack from a non-unique hazard creature keyed to a region of Mirkwood (by name or single region type) against one of your non-overt companies.

Unique. Playable at any Ruins & Lairs [R] in Wilderland if the influencing character bears Cham-en-Faroth, and if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: The Grimburgoth (+3), any unique faction playable at Dol Guldur (-2). TAP: and name a hazard creature in opponent's discard pile that has attacked your company this turn. Opponent then finds this creature, which immediately attacks the same company.

Sauron or Warlord only. Place this card with a region card; the region must be adjacent to a Shadow-land [s] or Dark-domain [d] that contains your avatar's home site (Dol Guldur if you are Sauron) or a site where you have a unique faction in play. Discard if these conditions are not met, your Warlord is at a site in another territory, or your play deck is exhausted. Target region is also considered a Shadow-land [s]. Any hero character moving in the region has his CC modified by -1. Cannot be duplicated for a region.

Playable on a non-Ringwraith minion character. Choose a type: Elf, Dunadan, Dwarf, Man, Orc, or Troll. Target character receives +1 prowess against attacks and strikes of the chosen type. Cannot be duplicated on a character.

Minion only. Prisoner. Playable on a company at a Darkhaven [K]. Bring a hero ally from your sideboard into your play deck. A character in the company may tap to play a hero ally normally worth 1 MP during the site phase at the site where the ally is playable (does not tap the site): place this card with the ally under control of the tapping host character. The ally is now a prisoner with the company and gives 0 MP; discard him if he is not a prisoner. This card gives 1 MP if the prisoner is stored. Cannot be duplicated for a prisoner.

Sauron only. Playable if you receive more MP than your opponent for at least one of the following categories: allies, characters, factions, items, or miscellaneous. Discard if this condition is not met. Cannot be duplicated. Once per turn, if you have more MP than your opponents for one of the above named categories, other than the one chosen to play this card, rotate this card 90deg (maximum once for each category). You receive this card's MP if it is rotated 360deg.

Minion only. Prisoner. As a permanent-event, instead of making a body check for an agent that attacked one of your companies, tap a character to take the agent prisoner with that company; place this card with the agent under control of the host character. Keep this card with the prisoner; it gives 2 MP if he is stored. Cannot be duplicated on a prisoner.  As a short-event, tap and reveal a face-down agent or force a face-up agent at your company's site to attack the company.

Unique. Helmet. Playable at any site in Gundabad. + 2 to body (to a maximum of 9). Unless this item is tapped, bearer makes a CC during his end-of-turn phase. Man or Dunadan only: +2 DI. The company may initiate CvCC regardless of their alignment. TAP: allow the bearer to face a strike from a non-detainment attack already assigned to another character in his company.

Black player only. Place this card on Khamul the Ringwraith if in play as your Ringwraith. You may start the game with this card in lieu of playing a minor item. If on Khamul, he becomes a Warlord and a leader. If in Black Rider mode, his company may move with region movement to any non-Free-hold site where gold rings are playable. Discard this card to take Dragon-helm of Uon from your discard pile to your hand. Cannot be duplicated.

Magic. Shadow-magic. Playable on a company with a shadow-magic-using character. Discard if the company does not contain such a character, or when your play deck is exhausted. One Gold Chains in the Wind may be placed "off to the side" with this card instead of discarding it from play. If placed with this card, the company is overt. It may be played as if from hand (not against the same attack); tap a shadow-magic-using character in the company if available (otherwise discard this card).

Playable on a Ringwraith. If his company is in a mode, tap target Ringwraith to force all non-Elf, non-avatar characters at his site to make a CC, or to bring a resource with his name in its card text from your discard pile or sideboard into your play deck. You may discard this card to allow the Ringwraith to use such a resource this turn as if he were your Ringwraith. Cannot be duplicated on a Ringwraith.

Playable on Usriev of Treachery. The Usriev gives +1 prowess and -1 to the body of any strike against its bearer. +1 to the body of any horse allies the bearer controls. If bearer is Uvatha the Ringwraith, Usriev affects him. If the bearer has defeated a strike with a body value, invert this card. If inverted, this card gives 1 MP. Cannot be duplicated on an Usriev.

Black player only. Playable on a Dark-hold [D]. Your characters and allies at the site may heal during the untap phase, and store resources and prisoners here. Fealty Under Trial is playable on characters at this site. When you store a prisoner here, you may take an Information resource from your discard pile to your hand (or any resource playable at Bag End if the prisoner is a Hobbit).

Environment. As a long-event, any disease played does not count against the hazard limit. As a short-event, discard The Watchful Peace if in play. Doors of Night is considered in play this turn; return any cards that can only be played if Doors of Night is not in play to their owner's hand.

Ritual. Playable during the site phase at a site where Information is playable on a non-unique minor or major weapon item in the company. Tap an overt sage or spirit-magic using character at the site and choose a type: Elf, Dwarf, Man, or Dunadan. Target weapon gives +2 prowess against the chosen type. The sage or spirit-magic-user makes a CC modified by -2. Cannot be duplicated on an item.

Stolen Knowledge. Playable during the site phase on a company at a site where an opponent's character is taken prisoner. Only playable as hero resource if opponent is a minion player or you have at least 10 SP. Opponent reveals his hand. May be stored at a Haven [H/DH]. Cannot be duplicated for a given prisoner. When you store this card, it gives 2 MP and you may name two cards. If opponent has any of these in hand, he must discard them (or else reveal his hand) and this card is inverted: all your ring tests are modified by +2.

Attacks against hero companies keyed to a region or site in Mirkwood receive +1 prowess and strikes for every two unique minion factions in play at such sites. Sauron or Warlord only: place any Burning Rick, Cot, and Tree or Smoke on the Wind you successfully play at a site in Mirkwood or its adjacent regions with this card. If there are two or more such cards placed with it, invert this card when another is placed with it; flip Wholesome Forest if in play. If inverted, this card gives 3 MP.

Scout only. Playable on a scout in a moving company. Tap scout. If played during the long-event phase, name a hazard; if opponent has this hazard in his hand, he must reveal it (or else his whole hand) and the play of any copy of this hazard counts as two against the hazard limit this turn. If played during the movement/hazard phase, return one card played on-guard at the company's new site to its owner's hand.

Playable at any tapped or untapped site with a Spawn or Spider automatic-attack; or at any site in Mirkwood if the company has faced a Spider attack this turn, if the influence check is greater than 6. Modifications: played at a non-Ruins & Lairs (-3). Cannot be duplicated at a given site. If you have a unique Spider faction or ally in play, this faction may move using region and Under-deeps movement.

Ringwraith followers at a Darkhaven [K] may use any of their abilities as if they were your Ringwraith. When using such an ability, the Ringwraith follower requires three points of influence to control that turn (regardless of other cards in play); he may not use such an ability if not enough influence is available to control him. Discard when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Playable on a company with an Orc leader. Discard if the company contains more than one non-Orc character or no Orc leader. There is no limit to the size of the company. Orcs in the company with a mind of 2 or less do not require any influence to be controlled. There is no limit to how many Orcs may be brought into play from hand with the company on a given turn. Attacks against the company cannot be cancelled.

Command. Playable on a leader. Return all other command cards on target leader to your hand when this card is played. -1 to his DI. You may place one Tribal Banner with him from hand. TAP: if the leader controls a Tribal Banner and at least two followers, and if you can assign a strike from an attack to him, to have the leader and his followers face the attack as if they were a separate company. Cannot be duplicated on a leader.

Minion only. Playable on a Dwarf or Elf sage with a mind of six or more at a Darkhaven [K]. Target sage receives +1 mind and +1 body. He may tap to take an ore card from your discard pile to your hand. When at a Darkhaven or Dark-hold [D], tap him and discard a Dark Forges from the company (or your MP) to play a non-unique lesser ring with a character in the company. Discard if there is a character with a higher mind in the company. Cannot be duplicated on a sage. May also be played in your starting company in lieu of a minor item.

Black player only. Place this card on your Ringwraith if he is in play. You may start the game with this card in lieu of playing a minor item. Your Ringwraith may tap to bring Powers Too Dark and Terrible into play from your sideboard (as if you were Sauron). Additionally, you may (at any time) wound your Ringwraith to allow him to use a ring he bears that turn (no body check required).

Playable on your Ringwraith at a Darkhaven [K]. Discard if he moves or becomes wounded. TAP: and tap your Ringwraith during the end-of-turn phase to name an opponent's unwounded, non-avatar warrior with a mind of 5 or more, at a site of which the minion version lists your Ringwraith's site as its nearest Darkhaven. During his organization phase, the warrior engages in CvCC with your Ringwraith (as if separate companies; not at any site). He may tap to cancel this CvCC. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Unique. Can only be brought into play from your sideboard, as result of another card's effects; minion players may bring Foundations Remain into play from their sideboard or hand, hero players Spies into Mordor. All versions of sites in Gorgoroth and Udun become Ruins & Lairs [R]. Automatic-attacks at these sites (as given on the site card) become Undead attacks. Unique resources may not be played by minion players at such sites. Any resource that can be stored at Barad-dur must be stored at Minas Morgul.

All non-creature attacks at sites in Gorgoroth, Imlad Morgul, Nurn, and Udun receive +1 to their prowess and strikes. Additionally, any site in these regions with Tower Raided does not leave active play. During the site phase at such a site, minion characters with a combined prowess of 15 or more may tap to discard Tower Raided from the hero version.

Playable during the organization phase on a sage at a Darkhaven [K]. Tap your Ringwraith at the site and make a body check for target sage. Afterwards, if he is still in play, rotate this card any number of times. Not rotated: the sage may use shadow-magic. Rotated once: the sage may use spirit-magic. Rotated twice: the sage may use sorcery.

Unique. Playable at Dol Guldur if you have The Necromancer in play, and if the influence check is greater than 9.  Standard Modifications: Black Trolls (+2), Orcs of Dol Guldur (-2). Any Troll attack at Dol Guldur receives +1 to its prowess and strikes and cannot be cancelled by resources that require a skill.

Playable on a Free-hold [F] at/on which Smoke on the Wind or People Diminished has been successfully played. Tap characters at the site with combined prowess of at least 15. Return any factions in play at the site to their owner's hand. The site does not leave active play. All versions of the site become Ruins & Lairs [R]. Discard if a unique faction or Rebuild the Town is in play at a version of the site. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

Playable on a character. If he is at the same non-Dark-hold, non-Darkhaven site as an opponent's company, he may tap to take An Untimely Whisper from your sideboard or discard pile to your hand; and he may play That Ain't No Secret, That's Been Heard Before Tonight, and The Names among Them there, regardless of the site's properties or his skills (or News of the Shire if opponent's company contains a Hobbit). Discard if his company is overt or initiates CvCC.

Once per turn, you may tap a Ringwraith to take Black Horse or Winged Terror from your sideboard or discard pile and place it "off to the side" with this card, or to give one such ally in the company +2 body that turn. Only one ally may be placed with this card at any time, and you may play it as if it were in your hand. You may start the game with this card in lieu of playing a minor item.

Unique. Armor. Hoard item. May also be played at Under-deeps sites (as if containing a hoard). +3 to body to a maximum of 10. Orc only: +1 prowess. If bearer is a leader, he cannot be discarded by a body check and receives +1 DI for every two Orc factions you have in play.

Playable on a company with an Orc leader. May be played on a starting company in lieu of a minor item. Instead of playing a 'free' minor item with the company, you may play Orc-draughts or Orc-liquor from your sideboard (or 2 such items if Orc-pouch is in the company). Additionally, during the organization phase you may discard Orc-draughts or Orc-liquor from the company to allow them to move an additional region that turn (to a maximum of 6). Discard if the company does not contain an Orc leader.

Playable at the end of the organization phase on a company that can legally move to a mountain region; only playable by a Fallen-wizard if A Strident Spawn is in play. This card is used as site card in a mountain region (place the region card with it): [S], draw 2/2. You may play A Few Recruits at this site. Discard if no company is at or moving to the site. Alternatively, playable on a Shadow-hold [S] or Dark-hold [D]. The site does not leave play. Discard when an opponent's company enters a version of the site.

Tap bearer and discard this item to replace it with one minor item, taken from your sideboard or discard pile. This must be an item that can be included with a starting company; if bearer is Lugdush or Radbug, you may take two such items (no Orc-pouch).

Unique. Playable at Gaurblog Lug, if the influence check is greater than 10. Modifications: an Orc faction is in play in Mordor or Wilderland (-2), +1 for each trophy in the company (+2 if a Dwarf-trophy). TAP: take Trouble on All Borders from your discard pile to your hand. This faction does not untap normally during the untap phase.

Lost Knowledge. Sage only at an untapped site where Information is playable. Tap the sage and the site and place this card with a hero item in the company. Target item now gives full MP (keep this card with it). If it is a battle-gear item, it may be used as if a minion item. Cannot be duplicated on an item.

Unique. Playable on Adunaphel -or Khamul the Ringwraith if (s)he is a Warlord and at Dol Guldur. Your avatar may tap to bring this card into play from your sideboard. He may play Black Rain as if he were a sage. During the organization phase at Dol Guldur, he may tap to take a Stolen Knowledge, Prisoner, or command card from your discard pile to your hand.

Unique. Playable on Akhorahil the Ringwraith or The Witch-king if he is a Warlord and at Minas Morgul. Your avatar may tap to bring this card into play from your sideboard. During the organization phase at Minas Morgul, he may tap to take Forced March, Grond, or a command card from your discard pile to your hand. Any Grond played on a faction at a site in Imlad Morgul can also affect sites in Anorien.

Whenever a Ringwraith you have in play must be taken back to your hand as result of a body check or ally leaving play, place him and any non-ally, non-item resources he controls with this card instead (discard any other cards). The Ringwraith and any cards he controls are "off to the side" and may be brought into play again with this card during the organization phase (as if from hand). Only one Ringwraith can be placed with this card.

Sauron only. Your avatar may tap to shuffle this card from your sideboard into your play deck. Reveal to yourself a number of cards from the top of your play deck equal to the number of ring items and ringbearers in play (+5 for The One Ring). Place these cards back on top of the play deck in any order you choose. Then your opponent must reveal two random cards from his sideboard for each ring in play.

Magic. Shadow-magic. Choose an opponent's non- avatar character at the same site as your shadow-magic-user: that character makes a CC modified by -5. If he fails, he splits off into a different company and is placed at a site of your choice in the same or an adjacent region (ignore any other effects). Shadow-magic-user makes a  CC modified by -3.

Black player only. Barad-dur is considered a Darkhaven [K] for the purpose of bringing characters into play and for Iron-road. Additionally, if Skies of Fire is in play, any site in Gorgoroth or Udun is considered a Darkhaven [K] for the purpose of storing and healing. Discard if Mordor in Ruins is in play. Cannot be duplicated.

Warrior only. Playable on an unwounded warrior facing a strike from a non-detainment attack. Wound the warrior and make a body check modified by +2. If he is still in play afterwards, the strike is ineffectual and you may take a resource or a Ringwraith from your play deck to your hand.

Ritual. Tap a sage to untap an item in his company. Alternatively, if the item has a skill-specific use, any character in the company with that skill may tap to untap the item. The character tapping makes a CC.

Unique. Mind Ring. Playable at Oraishapek's Mound if you reveal from hand a mind ring and remove it from the game. Bearer can use sorcery. +1 to his mind and +3 DI. At the end of each of his untap phases, bearer makes a roll: if the result is greater than his mind, he is tapped (or eliminated if he was wounded). TAP: take Some Secret Art of Flame from your discard pile to your hand.

Unique. Mind Ring. Playable at Temple of Lokuthor if you reveal from hand a mind ring and remove it from the game. Bearer can use shadow-magic. +1 to his mind and +3 DI. At the end of each of his untap phases, bearer makes a roll: if the result is greater than his mind, he is tapped (or eliminated if he was wounded). TAP: take Phantom Devised by Wizardry or Sojourn in Shadows from your discard pile to your hand.

Place this card on your Ringwraith if he is in play. +1 to his rolls for The Ring Leaves Its Mark ; when you play that card, instead of bringing a mode card to your play deck you may take it to your hand. You may discard this card to allow his company to move using region movement to a site where an opponent's ringbearer is present; if that ringbearer controls a tapped ring, they may move an extra region (to a maximum of 5). You may start the game with this card in lieu of a minor item.
All players may take one ring item from their discard pile to their hand. Alternatively, play to cancel the effects of Rolled down to the Sea before it resolves. Remove this card from the game.

Unique. Playable at Mathlaburg, if the influence check is greater than 7. Standard Modifications: the influencing character has a home site in Anduin Vales or Western Mirkwood (+2). TAP: reveal the top five cards of your play deck and take one ring item thus revealed to your hand (shuffle the rest back into the play deck).

Unique. Playable at Durthang if you have a sage and a leader at the site, and if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: Scara-hai Orc (+2), Ungol Orcs (-2), for each wolf ally in the company (+1). Your Orcs controlling Counterfeit are Scara-hai, not Half-orcs. This faction is also considered a Wolf faction. It gives 3 MP if you have a company with a Scara-hai at a site in Gondor.

Unique. Staff. Playable at Mistrand. +2 DI against Man characters and factions playable at sites in Harrhun or its adjacent regions. If bearer is a Man with a mind of five or more, he can use spirit-magic and receives +2 to his CC from using magic resources.

Command. Playable on a non-unique Orc leader or on Mauhur. May be played with a starting company in lieu of a minor item. The leader does not count towards the maximum number of leaders the company may contain. He gains an additional home site: any Shadow-hold [S] Orc-hold. Discard if the company does not contain an avatar or leader with a mind higher than target leader's.

NameEN: Servants in the South and East
Text: Minion only. Playable on a Man character with a home site in Mordor. The character becomes a leader. He is considered a Troll for the purpose of Whip and Orc factions. Any Man faction he successfully influences at a site in Mordor or its adjacent regions may be placed under his control (discard them if he leaves play).
fullCode: Servants in the South and East (NE)
normalizedtitle: servants in the south and east
DCpath: Necromancer/Servants in the South and East.jpg

Text: Trophy. Playable on a Foul Trophies. Keep this card with the Foul Trophies (discard either when the other leaves play). The Foul Trophies may be stored at a Darkhaven [K]. This card yields 1 trophy MP; it gives 1 MP if stored. Cannot be duplicated on a Foul Trophies.

Playable on a Saw-toothed Blade during the site phase at a Ruins & Lairs [R]. Tap the bearer of Saw-toothed Blade. The Blade now gives an extra +1 prowess (+3 against Elves and Maia). Cannot be duplicated on a Saw-toothed Blade.

Unique. Playable at Ostigurth if Hold Rebuilt and Repaired is played on the site, and if the influence check is greater than 8. Standard Modifications: overt leader (+2; +4 if bearing a Whip), any Orc faction playable at a site in Mordor (-2). Once in play, the number required to influence this faction is 0. TAP: bring a food item from your discard pile to your play deck and shuffle.

Warrior only. Trophy. Playable during the site phase on an untapped Orc or Troll, if you have an Orc or Troll faction in play normally worth 2 MP or more; must be played at a Free-hold [F], Border-hold [B], or Ruins & Lairs [R] in the region containing the site where the faction is playable (or an adjacent region). Target warrior faces an attack alone: Dunadan -- 1 strike with 12 prowess; if the attack is not defeated, discard this card. Cannot be duplicated at a site.

Playable during the site phase on a wounded Orc or Troll. Target character makes a body check modified by +2 (by +1 if he is a leader). If still in play afterwards, he may play an item normally playable at the site as if he were untapped (ignore any requirement that he must tap; character remains wounded). Otherwise, the company faces all automatic-attacks again and the site phase immediately ends.

Unique. Playable at Mountains of Mirkwood, if the influence check is greater than 11. Standard Modifications: eliminate a character or prisoner in the company to modify the check by adding his mind. This faction may only move to sites in Mirkwood. TAP: bring Flies and Spiders or Spiders Huge and Horrible from your discard pile to your play deck.

Quest. Playable in lieu of playing a minor item with a starting company. Cannot be duplicated by a player. When you have a company at a site in Mordor, bring Mordor in Ruins into play from your sideboard (if not in play). Whenever you play a Stolen Knowledge card with a company at a site in Mordor, rotate this card 90deg; you may store Stolen Knowledge at any Border-hold [B] or Free-hold [F]. If fully rotated, when you store a Stolen Knowledge card you may flip this card.

Quest. Playable in lieu of playing a minor item with a starting company; any player may bring Strange as News from Bree into play from his sideboard. Cannot be duplicated by a player. Discard a Stolen Knowledge card from play to force opponent to reveal his hand. If he has a character in hand, he must discard it or you may shuffle one hazard from your sideboard into your play deck (opponent's choice); you may flip this card.

Playable on an Orc or Troll character. Target receives +2 prowess against Vermin. If he is wounded, once per phase he may use a resource or cancel a hazard effect that would require a character with one of his skills to tap; instead of tapping, he makes a body check modified by +2 (by +1 if he is a leader). Cannot be duplicated on a character.

Unique. Spawn. Manifestation of Spider of the Morlat. Playable at The Sulfur-deeps. Unless you eliminate a trophy in the company, opponent makes a roll during the end-of-turn phase; if the result is greater than the prowess of its controlling character, the company faces an attack: Spider -- 1 strike with 16 prowess (cannot be cancelled; any character wounded is eliminated). TAP: cancel a Spider or Spawn attack against the company.

Unique. Playable on an Orc leader at a site with an automatic-attack in Wilderland or its adjacent regions. +1 to target leader's mind. He may tap to untap one of his followers. Command cards he controls are not returned to your hand automatically. If he bears Whip, one command card he controls does not give -2 DI. Discard if an Orc with a mind higher than target leader's is in play.

Playable on a company with at least two Orcs facing an attack (not a non-combat attack). Each Orc and each wolf ally in the company receives +1 prowess (+2 against Dwarves) and -1 body against this attack, and also against the next attack the company faces this turn. Cannot be duplicated for a given attack.

Black player only. Place this card on The Witch-king if in play as your Ringwraith. You may play this card in lieu of a minor item in your starting company and start the game at Carn Dum; The Witch-king gains this site as a home site. If on The Witch-king, he becomes a Warlord and a leader. The Iron Crown affects him. Discard this card to take Vasamacil or Sea-helm of Ciryatan from your discard pile to your hand. Cannot be duplicated.

Manifestation of The Lidless Eye. Playable if you have not revealed a Ringwraith and your opponent is not a black player. You are Sauron; you may not play any Ringwraith. Discards and prevents play of Bade to Rule. +3 to your GI. Each of your agent minions requires one less influence to control and you may bring them into play at any Darkhaven [K]. Your overt companies have their hazard limit increased by 1 (to a minimum of 3). TAP: during the organization phase to bring one card from your sideboard to your play deck (or 3 to the discard pile). Cannot be duplicated.

Unique. Staff. +3 DI against Orc factions playable at sites in Mordor. If bearer is an overt leader, he may automatically influence any Orc faction only playable at Cirith Ungol. Discard to give bearer +3 prowess against a strike; after the strike, untap all tapped Orcs in his company.

Playable on your Ringwraith or Wizard if you have Powers Too Dark and Terrible or Spells Born of Discord in play. TAP: if your avatar is able to use a ring he bears, to tap that ring and use it as if he had tapped; your hand size is increased by one and the ring cannot be used again this turn. If he is a Wizard, the avatar makes a CC. Cannot be duplicated by a player.

Playable on a prisoner you have stored at Barad-dur or Dol Guldur. Discard if target is not a prisoner. At the start of each of his organization phases, rotate this card 90deg and make a body check for the prisoner, modified by +1 for each time rotated. If still in play afterwards, all of opponent's characters with the same home site as the prisoner must make a CC, modified by -1 for each time rotated (to a maximum of -3). If the prisoner is eliminated, store this card: it gives 2 MP. Cannot be duplicated on a prisoner.

-2 to your GI (-1 if you are The Witch-king). You may start the game with this card in lieu of playing a minor item. When your mode event is discarded at a Darkhaven [K], you may discard this card instead of any Ringwraith followers. TAP: take a Ringwraith or They Ride Together from your discard pile to your hand. If you have played They Ride Together this turn, your Ringwraith's company may use region movement.

Sauron only. Diplomat only. +3 to an influence check by the diplomat against a Man, Dwarf, or Dunadan faction (+6 if the faction is playable at his home site). If this is an opponent's hero faction, the check receives an additional +6; if successful, the faction is not discarded but placed in your MP together with this card. The faction cannot tap and does not give any MP. Cannot be duplicated for an influence check.

When you store a Stolen Knowledge card (to a maximum of twice per turn), place it with this card, rotate this card 90deg, and rotate any other There's Queer Folk About back 90deg; you may take Secret News or An Untimely Whisper from your sideboard or discard pile to your hand. If it is fully rotated, this card gives 3 MP.

Black player only. Diplomat only. Playable on a Border-hold [B] if you tap a diplomat at the site. Cannot be duplicated on a site. The site does not leave active play. If there is a faction in play at any version of the site, this card gives 1 MP. Any unique hero faction in play at the site gives 1 less faction MP (even to a Fallen-wizard). A hero diplomat or avatar at the site may tap to discard this card.

May only be borne by an Orc or Troll. You may place any trophy bearer controls with this item (keep them with it); it now cannot be transferred (unless bearer is eliminated). If bearer controls more MP from trophies than any other character in the company, he must be assigned a strike of any attack against the company that does not choose defending characters. If there are trophies with this item worth a total of 3 MP or more, bearer becomes a leader, and this item gives 2 MP if stored.

Magic. Sorcery. Playable on a Darkhaven [K], Dark-hold [D], or Shadow-hold [S]. Cannot be duplicated on a site. Tap a sorcery-using character at the site and make a CC modified by -4 to place a non-unique Awakened Plant creature with this card, taken from your hand or your company at the site. Only one creature can be with this card. You may play it as hazard creature against a company moving in the site's region (or an adjacent region), or discard it to cancel an Awakened Plant attack against your company.

When you successfully play a Dragon faction having modified the influence attempt by discarding an item (or removing it from the game), rotate this card 90deg and rotate any Gold beyond Price or Count back 90deg. For each time rotated, this card gives 1 MP and your Fever of Unrest require one fewer Wilderness [w] to play a Dragon hazard creature. Additionally, you may play Long Grievous Siege on your Dragon factions, and one hazard event in response to an opponent's company facing an attack created by your Dragon faction.

Playable on your Ringwraith. Once per turn, he may tap to look at a number of cards from the top of any one play deck, equal to twice the number of factions you have in play at sites in his territory. If from opponent's play deck, place these cards back on top in random order. If from your play deck, choose and take one into your hand, and return the rest to the top of your play deck in any order you choose.

Black player only. Place on Uvatha the Ringwraith if in play as your Ringwraith. You may play this card in lieu of a minor item in your starting company and start the game at Mistrand; Uvatha gains this site as a home site. If on Uvatha, he becomes a Warlord and a leader. Any attack against his company receives -1 to its prowess and strikes (to a minimum of 2) for each Uvatha Unleashed played this turn. Discard to take Bat-winged Helmet or Messenger of Mordor from your discard pile to your hand. Cannot be duplicated.

Unique. Weapon. Playable by The Witch-king at any site in Eriador or Gondor (does not tap the site). This item only affects The Witch-king; he may use sorcery and need not be taken to hand on a body check result of 8. Any non-unique Undead hazard creature may be played keyed to his region. Undead attacks against his company are always detainment. TAP: search your discard pile for a Riven Gate and play it on The Witch-king (as if from hand).

Flip Mordor in Ruins (if in play). You may play Tower Raided on any Dark-hold [D] in Mordor (as if a Shadow-hold [S]). Invert this card when you successfully play Tower Raided on a site in Mordor. If inverted, this card gives 3 MP. Only one copy of this card can be inverted. Re-invert it if you do not have Tower Raided on a site in Mordor, or when Dark Spires Rising becomes inverted.

Command. Playable on an Uruk-hai facing a strike. The Uruk-hai immediately faces a strike of the attack assigned to another Orc in the company (instead of that Orc); he receives +2 prowess and -1 body against that strike. If still in play afterwards, he resolves his strike and makes a CC modified by -2.

Unique. TAP: during the organization phase and discard a magic card from hand to search your play deck or discard pile and take up to three of the following cards to your hand: Helm of Fear, Morgul-blade, Morgul-knife, The Fiery Blade, or an item only playable by a Ringwraith. This card does not untap normally; instead, tap your avatar to untap it.

Attacks against minion and overt companies keyed to a region or site in Mirkwood receive +1 prowess and strikes for every two unique hero factions in play at such sites. Once per organization phase, you may tap such a faction to heal a character or ally at a site in Mirkwood (from wounded to tapped). Invert this card when you store Pass the Doors of Dol Guldur or Towers Destroyed becomes fully rotated; flip any Land of the Necromancer in play. If inverted, this card gives 3 MP (even to an Elf-lord).

Ritual. Playable on Woodmen-town. Discard a minor item from a company at this site to heal (from wounded to untapped) a non-overt, non-Ringwraith character at the site. Alternatively, discard this card during the organization phase to heal (from wounded to untapped) a character anywhere whose home site is Woodmen-town. Cannot be duplicated on a site.

Winged. Playable by a Ringwraith at a tapped or untapped Barad-dur, Dol Guldur, or Minas Morgul. Return its controlling Ringwraith to your hand if this ally leaves play. The company is overt. If each Ringwraith in the company controls a Winged Terror or Creature of an Older World, the company is in Fell Rider mode: discard any other allies in the company. TAP: allow its controlling Ringwraith to assign his strike in CvCC.

Playable if you have a Wolf faction in play, on an Orc-hold where you have an Orc faction in play. Discard if these conditions are not met. Your wolf allies at the site heal during their untap phase. Orc-mounts can be duplicated on your companies with two or more wolf allies. Cannot be duplicated on a given site. TAP: during the organization phase to take a wolf ally or Orc-mounts from your discard pile to your hand.

Unique. Playable at Thuringwathost or Urlurtsu Nurn, if the influence check is greater than 11. Modifications: Ringwraith (+4), magic-user (+2). Each time a creature or character is eliminated while its body (check) was modified by your Morgul-blade or The Fiery Blade, place it with this faction; it gives normal kill MP. This faction gives +1 MP for each card placed with it (to a maximum of 4). Remove any cards placed with it from the game when Banishment is played at a site in Nurn.

Playable on a non-unique Orc. The Orc need not tap to take a character prisoner. If he controls a prisoner, he receives +1 to his prowess and body. Additionally, if you are a Fallen-wizard, target Orc becomes a Half-orc; if you are a black player, he becomes a Scara-hai. Cannot be duplicated on a given Orc.

Nearest Haven: Lorien  Playable: Items (minor, major)  Automatic-attacks: Orcs -- each character faces a strike with 8 prowess    Special: Stolen Knowledge. When this site would be discarded, you may place it with the leaving company or store it; it is considered a Stolen Knowledge resource and you may discard it to cancel all attacks from Mordor in Arms or Barad-wath against one of your companies.
Path: d s s s s w

Text: Nearest Darkhaven: Minas Morgul  Automatic-attacks: Orcs -- each character faces a strike with 7 prowess (detainment against overt companies)   Special: The Orcs of the Ephel Duath faction is playable here. While this site is in play, any hero company moving with Gorgoroth and Nurn in their site path faces an attack at the start of the movement/hazard phase: Orcs -- 4 strikes with 9 prowess.

Nearest Haven: Lorien  Playable: Items (minor, major, greater)  Automatic-attacks (2): (1st) Orcs -- 4 strikes with 7 prowess; (2nd) Wolves -- 3 strikes with 8 prowess  Special: Stolen Knowledge. Werewolf may be played at this site. When this site would be discarded, you may place it with the leaving company or store it; it is considered a Stolen Knowledge resource, and you may discard it to cancel a Demon or Wolf attack against one of your companies.
Path: d d s w f b w

Text: Nearest Darkhaven: Minas Morgul  Automatic-attacks: Orcs. Wolves -- 2 strikes with 7 prowess (detainment)   Special: Any non-unique wolf ally is playable at this site by a Scara-hai Orc who does not control a wolf ally. While this site is in play, all Demon attacks against companies at or moving to a site in Mordor or its adjacent regions receive +1 to their prowess and strikes.

Nearest Haven: Edhellond  Playable: Items (minor, major, greater)  Automatic-attacks (2): (1st) Men -- 4 strikes with 9 prowess; (2nd) If Adunaphel is in play as a permanent-event, it must be used as an additional automatic-attack (only remove it from play if defeated)   Special: Tower Raided may be played at this site; if played successfully, opponent must discard one cult card he has in play.
Playable: Items(minor, major, greater*)   *non-battle gear items only

Text: Nearest Darkhaven: Minas Morgul  Automatic-attacks: Men -- 2 strikes with 8 prowess (detainment)   Special: The Haradrim faction is playable at this site. Adunaphel the Ringwraith may be brought into play here. While this site is in play, all Man attacks keyed to a region of Mordor or its adjacent regions receive +1 to their prowess and strikes.

Nearest Haven: Lorien  Playable: Information, Items (minor)  Automatic-attacks: Men -- 2 strikes with 7 prowess (detainment)    Special: Port-on-Anduin. Any agent with a home site in Wilderland or Eriador may be brought into play here (as agent; face-up). Agents at this site attack with +2 to their prowess.

Nearest Darkhaven: Dol Guldur  Playable: Information, Items (minor)  Automatic-attacks: Men -- 2 strikes with 7 prowess (detainment against covert companies)    Special: Port-on-Anduin. Any agent with a home site in Wilderland or Eriador (or any Man agent if you are Sauron) may be brought into play here (as agent; face-up). Agents at this site attack with +2 to their prowess.

Nearest Haven: Lorien  Playable: Items (minor, major)  Automatic-attacks (2): (1st) Orcs -- 4 strikes with 8 prowess; (2nd) Pukel-creature -- 1 strike with 9 prowess  Special: If a company here contains a Stolen Knowledge card, any special item playable only at a site in Mordor or its adjacent regions is playable here.
Path: d s w f b w

Text: Nearest Darkhaven: Minas Morgul  Automatic-attacks: Troll -- 1 strike with 11 prowess (detainment against black players' companies)   Special: The Uruk-hai and Orcs of the Ash Mountains factions are playable here; any influence attempt against these factions at this site is modified by +2.

Nearest Haven: Rhubar  Playable: Items (minor, major)  Automatic-attacks: Men -- each character faces a strike with 7 prowess   Special: Port-on-Sea of Rhun. Pirates may be played at this site, with +1 to its prowess and strikes.

Nearest Darkhaven: Dol Guldur  Playable: Items (minor, major)  Automatic-attacks: Men -- 3 strikes with 7 prowess (detainment)   Special: Port-on-Sea of Rhun. The Corsairs of Rhun faction is playable here. While this site is in play, Pirates may be played keyed to Sea of Rhun and its adjacent regions, and also at sites therein, with +1 to its prowess and strikes.

Nearest Haven: Lorien  Playable: Information, Items (minor)  Automatic-attacks: Spiders -- 3 strikes with 7 prowess   Special: Rescue Prisoners may be played at this site; when played successfully, you may take Lock nor Bar May Hinder from your discard pile to your hand.

Nearest Darkhaven: Dol Guldur  Playable: Information, Items (minor)  Automatic-attacks: Spiders -- 3 strikes with 7 prowess    Special: This site counts as Shelob's Lair for the purpose of No Better Use.

Nearest Haven: Rhubar  Playable: Information, Items (minor)  Automatic-attacks: Men -- 3 strikes with 7 prowess   Special: Stolen Knowledge. When this site would be discarded, you may place it with the leaving company or store it; it is considered a Stolen Knowledge resource, and you may discard it (at any time) to cancel a magic event played by a character at one of your companies' site before it resolves.

Playable on a Dragon faction. Choose another Dragon faction in active play that shares at least 1 region for its attack with target faction. Make a roll adding the number regions that both factions share for their attack, plus any influence modification against each other (ignoring the negative); if the result is greater than opponent's free GI, the two factions attack each other. Each faction's prowess and body are equal to the attack on their card and the controlling player makes the roll. No resources may be played. If a Dragon faction is thus eliminated remove this card from the game. Otherwise the loosing faction is wounded (invert it); it is worth half its normal mp (round down) and can be healed by making a successful influence attempt against the faction. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

[MP: 2*; P/B: 10/6] Men. Each character in the company faces a strike (detainment against covert and hero companies). May also be played on Dale or Lake- town, creating an additional automatic-attack (discard Bardings at the end of the site phase).              May not be played against a covert or hero company containing a character with a home site in Dorwinion, Northern Rhovanion, or Southern Rhovanion.

Playable on a Dragon character. He receives -3 body. When the Dragon-character does not tap to face a strike of an attack, he receives an additional -3 prowess penalty. If at his home site (or any Dragon's Den [K]) during his organization phase, target Dragon may tap to discard this card.

[MP: 3; P/B: 12/8] Unique. Fire-dragon. May be played at Cirith Helkaloke. Winged. 2 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. [MP: 1*; P/B: 8/0] Dwarves. 4 strikes. +4 prowess and -1 to target's body against companies containing a Dragon or Drake. May only be played against an overt company. May be played keyed to any region containing a Dragon's lair or Dwarf-hold, and keyed on any non-Haven site in those regions.

Playable on an attack by True Fire-drake, Winged Fire-drake, or on any Fire-dragon attack (must be played before strikes are assigned). Each character in the company being attacked must immediately face a strike equal to the attack's prowess. Instead or using prowess against the strike, each character uses his body modified by +1 if he has a shield, by +1 if he has a helmet, and by +3 if he taps. The target attack which follows receives +1 body and -2 prowess. Cannot be duplicated on a given attack.

Playable on a Dragon character moving away from his home site or any Dragon's Den [K]. Unless opponent discards Hunger or a manifestation of target Dragon from his hand, the Dragon must return to his site of origin.

Playable on a company that has faced an attack from a unique Dragon manifestation this turn. You may play Foes Shall Fall or Bring Our Curses Home on the company as if played (normally) on the attack; it may also be played from the discard pile.

Playable on a site. Until the end of the turn, the company must face all of the site's automatic- attacks each time an item is played at the site; these attacks receive +1 prowess per item played at the site this turn. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

[MP: 1; P/B: 12/7] Animal. Bear. 1 strike. +4 prowess against Dragons. May not be played against a company containing a character with Beorn's House as a home site. Cannot be duplicated on a given movement/hazard phase.

Environment. Playable on a company using flying movement. Make a roll. If the result is less than 7, tap all characters and allies in the company. Otherwise, the company is not considered flying for the rest of the turn (change the site path accordingly; if the company cannot reach the new site, defender must choose a new within 2 regions of the original site of destination).

Any card effect that forces a player to show opponent his hand, also forces opponent to show his hand.     Additionally, any Will Shaken revealed from the play deck as result of an opponent's action or card effect, affects opponent as if revealed from hand. Cannot be duplicated.

Playable on a Dragon character. All attacks by Apes, Bears, Boars, Eagles and Whales receive +1 strike and -2 body. Each character wounded by such an attack must make an additional body check. Discard this card if such an attack is defeated.

Only playable on a character facing a strike from Dragon's Breath. +2 to the prowess of the strike. NameEN: A Gift for Lords of Men
Text: Dragon-lord specific. Offering Attempt. Playable during CvCC, before strikes are assigned. Transfer an item your Dragon-lord bears worth at least 2 mp to a non-Hobbit, non-avatar character in opponent's company. Your Dragon-lord then makes an influence attempt against this character modified by adding the mp of the item, and by +2 if the Dragon-lord is a diplomat. If successful, target character joins the Dragon-lord's company; discard all non-follower, non-item cards on the character. CvCC then proceeds normally.
fullCode: A Gift for Lords of Men (GW)
normalizedtitle: a gift for lords of men

Text: [MP: 3; CP: 2] Unique. Playable at Cirith Helkaloke or Steel Fall. Weapon: +3 prowess (to a maximum of 9 or double the bearer's base prowess). [SP: 1] Playable on a Dragon character not at a Dragon's Den [K]. -3 to all his rolls to bring a character into play or to keep a character in play. Discard this card if such a roll fails. Cannot be duplicated on a given Dragon.

[SP: 2] Playable on a Dragon character. If at or moving to a site that is not in a region containing a Dragon's Lair or a Dragon's Den [K], or region adjacent to these, the following applies:     tap: untap target Dragon or cancel an attack against his company. This card does not untap normally; instead you may tap bearer to untap this card.     Discard this card to cancel any effect that would cancel CvCC with target Dragon's company or an influence attempt by target Dragon.   Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

[MP: (1)] Flying. Playable at any tapped or untapped Shadow-hold [S] or Dark-hold [D] if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: Each Great Bats or Swarm of Bats with the company (+2).   Once in play, the number required to influence this faction is 0. This faction is worth 1 mp if you have a unique Orc faction in play at the site where it was played.     tap: during your movement/hazard phase to cancel the effects of The Sun Shone Fiercely or Glance of Arien for one of your moving companies or characters this turn.  Cannot be duplicated at a given site.
Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Playable on your Dragon-lord. +5 to his EI this turn, or +3 to one of his rolls for a flattery, riddling or offering attempt. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

Dragon-magic. Playable on a Dragon- character's company during CvCC, before strikes are assigned. Make a roll for each character in opponent's company. If the roll is higher than the character's mind, he is tapped.      Alternatively, playable on a magic using Dragon character facing a non-automatic- attack. The attack is cancelled.  Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

[MP: (3)] Sauron specific. You may bring one Balrog or Dragon character from your sideboard to your play deck when you play this card (reshuffle). You may bring such a character into play at his home site; place this card with the character when he enters play, it is worth 3 mp. Your Balrog characters costs 10 points of influence to control. Unless at a Darkhaven [K] no other characters may be in a company with one of your Balrog and Dragon characters.     Additionally, you may play Balrog specific resources that are only playable by/on a Balrog. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Warrior only. Playable on a Dwarf, Man, Orc or Sinda Elf bearing an axe. If bearer is chosen to face a strike from an attack with less strikes than the prowess bonus the axe gives against the attack, you may tap the axe and the character to face any number of strikes from the attack (in separate strike sequences). Each body check bearer makes is modified by an additional +1. Bearer makes a CP. This card gives 2 corruption points to an overt or minion character. Discard if bearer does not bear an axe.

[MP: 2(3); CP: 2(3); DI: +2; Prowess: +2(+4)] Unique. Hoard item. Weapon. Warrior only: +2 prowess to a maximum of 9 (maximum of 11 against Dwarves).    If borne by an Orc leader: +4 prowess against Dwarves, +2 DI against Orcs, 3 mp and 3 CP.

Unique. Playable by a white player if you have at least 1 Dwarf and 1 Elf or Man faction in play. Playable by a grey or black player if you have at least 1 Orc and 1 Wolf faction in play. Make a roll and designate 2 of your factions of the above named types for your alignment. If the result plus the total mp of both factions is: less than 9 -- you must discard 1 of your designated factions; 11 or greater -- your opponent must discard 1 of his factions of the above named types in play in the same territory as one of your factions. Remove this card from the game.

[MP: 2(3); CP: 2(4)] Unique. Jewel. Treasure. Playable at Tower of the Wolf-friend. Sage only. Tap sage and make a roll (+3 for magic users) when facing a Drake creature attack against his company. If the result plus his mind is greater than the attack's prowess, place the creature with this item, it becomes an ally with a normal prowess -7 (cannot be influenced). Only one creature may be with this item at any time. During the untap phase, make the same roll as if the creature would attack (discrd if the roll fails, or if you so chose). Values in parenthesis apply when a creature is with this item.

[SP: 1] Dragon-lord specific. Playable on an attack by a Dragon hazard- manifestation against your Dragon-lord's company. Tap your Dragon-lord. The attack is cancelled and the Dragon becomes an ally under the control of your Dragon-lord (place him with this card; ignore its card text). Its mind and mp are equal to half its normal mp (round down), prowess is equal to its normal prowess minus 7 (normal body). The ally's skills are warrior if played on a Fire-dragon; scout, if a Winged-dragon; ranger, if a Cold- or Ice- dragon; sage if a female Dragon; diplomat if a male Dragon.     During your organization phase, opponent makes a roll (modified by +1 for each copy of this card on your Dragon-lord). If the result is greater than your Dragon-lord's mind, the ally attacks him (ally's current prowess plus dice roll; cannot be cancelled). After this attack, discard this card and the ally.

[MP: 2(4); CP: 2(3); Body: +1] Unique. Hoard item. Armor. +1 body (to a maximum of 9). A stored Reforging may be placed with this item to "restore" it. Once restored, Belegennon gives 4 mp and 3 corruption points.     Warrior only (if restored): if bearer chooses not to tap against a strike he receives no prowess penalty.

[MP: 1] Unique. Vermin. Playable at a site in Anduin Vales by a character with Beorn's House as a home site, if the influence check is greater than 5.      tap: : ap: during your end-of-turn phase to bring one Beijabar Bees from your discard pile or sideboard to your play deck and shuffle. This faction only untaps if one of your companies is at Beorn's House.

[CP: 1(2)] Warrior only. Playable on Alatar or a Dunadan, Elf, Man or Orc, if bearing a blade (e.g. a sword or a dagger). If bearer is chosen to face a strike from an attack, you may tap the blade: if the strike is defeated, any remaining strikes from this attack have its prowess and body reduced by the bonuses the blade gives against this attack. Otherwise discard the blade. Bearer makes a CP.     This card gives 2 CP to an overt or minion character. Discard if bearer does not bear a blade.

[MP: 3; Mind: 5; P/B: 8/9] Magic. Shadow-magic. Undead. Overt. Playable only on a shadow-magic using character at a tapped or untapped site where an at home Dragon manifestation has been defeated. Unless he is a Ringwraith, the character  makes a CP modified by -4. Cannot be duplicated for an eliminated Dragon manifestation. Discard if not in the company with a shadow-magic using character.
[MP: 2; CP: 2; Prowess: +2; Body: (+1)] Hoard item. Weapon. +2 prowess to a maximum of 8 (+3 prowess to a maximum of 9 against Undead). Warrior only: +1 to body to maximum of 8.

[CP: 1] Playable on a character bearing and able to use a bow. If target character bears a bow he may tap for Wielded Twice or Raised Again as if he were a sage: shuffle Wielded Twice/Raised Again in the play deck instead of discarding it (if you so choose).

[SP: 1] Dragon-lord specific. Your GI is increased by a number based on the mp of your stored hoard items:     1 - 5 mp: +1;    7 - 11 mp: +3;    12 - 17 mp: +5;    18 or more mp +7.  Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Magic. Spirit-magic. Song. Playable on a spirit-magic using character whose company faces a non- automatic, non-maia attack. The attack becomes detainment. Unless he is a Ringwraith, the character makes a CP modified by -3.

[MP: 1; SP: 2; DI: +2] Dragon-lord specific. Playable on your Dragon-lord if you have a Gathered Bone in your mp with an mp of 3 or more. +2 to his DI. -2 to his riddling rolls. You may take a Dragon-lord specific card from your sideboard to your hand when you play this card (or from your discard pile if you are Smaug). Discard this card after a failed riddling roll. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Playable on a Dragon. Each strike against the Dragon receives -1 prowess and -1 body (-2/-2 for a non-warrior Dragon). Discard this card after a strike against the Dragon fails. Cannot be duplicated on a given Dragon.

[MP: 3] Unique. Manifestation of Corlagon. Playable at Cirith Helkaloke if the influence check is greater than 12.  Modifications: influencer discards a major item (+3) or a greater item (+6); if a manifestation of Gondring or Scorba is in play (-3).      All attacks by manifestations of Corlagon against any of your companies are cancelled. Any company moving in Angmar, Dragon Gap, Forochel, Gundabad, and/or Misty Mountains - Northern Spur faces an attack: Fire-dragon -- 2 strikes at 12/8 prowess/body (attacker chooses defending characters).

Flattery attempt. Playable on a character attempting to influence a faction. Tap the character and make a roll modified by +2 if the character is a diplomat; one diplomat only resource or resource that modifies flattery attempts may be played to modifiy this roll. If the result is greater than the listed values, the influence attempt against the faction is automatically successful without tapping the site, otherwise discard the faction. Against a Hobbit, Man, or Animal faction: 10; against a Dwarf, Wose, Orc or Troll faction: 11; against an Elf, Eagle, Dunadan or Ent faction: 12.

[SP: 2] Dragon-lord specific. Place this card on your Dragon-lord if he is in play. You may place any site your Dragon-lord's company moves away from under this card instead of discarding it. Additionally, your Dragon-lord may tap to place a site in the same or an adjacent region as his current site under this card; (versions of) such site may not be in active play, cannot be a Dragon's Den [K], and one of the considered regions must contain a Dragon's Den.      Any version of a site under this card comes into play tapped; it may be untapped if a company at the site discards a Rebuild the Town, Hold Rebuild and Repaired or Drive Back the Shadow from hand or play during the site phase.

[MP: 1; SP: 1] Dragon only. Playable on a Dragon character. Any non-Dragon faction brought into play by the Dragon may be placed with this card.      If a faction is with this card, you may place it with the Dragon's current Border-hold [B] or Shadow-hold [S]: it is worth 1 mp and all other player's companies moving through the region containing the site face an attack for each faction attached (type same as faction). This attack has a number of strikes equal to the mp of the faction, and each strike has 8 prowess and 7 body. If the attack is defeated opponent receives the faction as kill mp.  Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Offering attempt. Playable on a character whose company is facing a non-detainment attack of the type listed below. Character makes a roll modified by his unused EI, +2 if a diplomat, +3 for each non-unique animal ally (or character taken prisoner) that you decide to eliminate from the company. If successful, the attack is cancelled and the hazard limit for the character's company is decreased by 2. This influence check is successful if the result is greater than: 11 against a Dragon; 12 against Drakes, Giant, Orcs, or Trolls, 13 against Awakend Plants, Demons or Spawn.

[SP: 2; Mind: -2] Dragon-lord specific. Playable on a company. A character (even a non-Dwarf hero) with a mind up to 8 may be played with the company at a Dragon's Den [K]; place this card with the character. -2 to his mind to a minimum of 4. No rolls are required for this character to stay in play. This card may also be played with a starting company in lieu of a minor item (reveal it when starting companies are determined as if it were a character).     Alternatively, may also be played on a character in an opponent's company at your Dragon-lord's site. All influence attempts against this character are modified by +4; if the attempt is successfull, the characacter joins your company. Cannot be duplicated by a given Dragon-lord.

[MP: 1; CP: 2] Treasure. If stored, all Dragon and Drake attacks are modified by -1 to prowess, body and strikes (to a minimum of 1)
