Special: Volcano. Any non-unique Drake not keyable to a Coastal Sea [ c] region may be played at this site. Non-Nazgul creatures played at this site attack normally, not as detainment

Adjacent Sites: Eithel Morgoth (0), Ancient Maze (6), The Iron-deeps (5), The Pits of Angband (7)  Special: Volcano. Any gold ring stored at this site is automatically tested (modify the roll by -2). If one of your companies is at this site, all attacks against it are cancelled

Playable if The One Ring is in play and borne by a non- Hobbit character with a mind greater than 4. Discard if these conditions are not met. The mp  and all bonusses from other special items in play are modified by -1 (to a minimum   of 1). Additionally, all CP by other ringbearers are modified by -1, and any Narya, Nenya or Vilya cannot be used.

Playable on a grey or white player's company. The hazard player may choose another site path for the company; the region and site of origin and arrival must remain the same, but for each ring item in the company the site path may contain 1 extra region. The new site path must contain a Shadow-land [s] or a Dark-domain [kd].

As a permanent event, any character bearing a Ring for Mortal Men targeted by a stature card has his mind reduced by 3. Any character whose mind is reduced to 0 or less due to the effects of this card is eliminated; a Sauron player receives his mp as character mp.      As a short event, playable on a Dunadan or Man character with a body less than 9: character must make a CP modified by -2.

Playable on the bearer of a ring special item. He must make a CP, modified by subtracting the CP the ring gives him. Failing this CP the hazard player may replace the character's new or current site with a site in an adjacent region as close as possible to Gorgoroth (ignore any other effects). If the bearer of The One Ring moves to Dol Guldur or Barad-dur in this manner the game ends: a black player wins the game as though he had recovered The One Ring, otherwise it is a tie.

Playable on a gold ring item. The ring is now tested; opponent may apply a modifier of +2 or -2 to the roll (before the roll). If a non-unique ring is playable as result of the test, it may be played from hand or discard pile. If a ring special item is played, the bearer must then make a CPC.
For every ring item in a company one Nazgul or Maia, or one Dunadan or Man hazard creature with an asterix (*) may be played not counting against the hazard limit. Cannot be duplicated.

NameEN: One Ring to Bring Them All
Text: Unique. All characters in the same territory as the bearer of The One Ring (or territory adjacent for a character bearing a ring) that are allowed to move must attempt to move to the same site as the bearer of The One Ring. If they may not legally move to that site, they must attempt to move to the nearest possible site (defender's choice).
fullCode: One Ring to Bring Them All (MM)
normalizedtitle: one ring to bring them all
DCpath: MortalMen/One Ring to Bring Them All.jpg

Text: Playable on a strike from an agent attacking a character bearing a ring special item. May be played on-guard and revealed if an agent attacks. If played on My Precious, the strike receives +4 prowess and cannot be cancelled. Discard this card if the strike is not successful. Otherwise, no body check is made, but the agent takes control of a ring special item borne by the defending character (attackers's choice); Any character defeating a strike from this agent may take control of the ring (no body check is made).

Playable on a character taken prisoner at a Dark-hold [D]. Make a roll: if the result is greater than the character's mind (+3 for Hobbits), the character becomes a minion agent controlled by the hazard player. Discard all other hazard permanent-events on the agent.  This card cannot be targeted by resource events.  During the organization phase, a sage at the same site as the character may tap to attempt to remove this card. Make a roll; add 1 for each additional sage or diplomat in the company that taps in support: if the result plus the character's mind is greater than 10, discard this card; the character joins the sage's company and is controlled by the sage's controlling player.

NameEN: You've Put Your Finger In It
Text: Playable on a non-Wizard, non-Ringwraith character bearing a ring. The hazard limit for the character's company is increased by one for every ring item in the company. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.  During the organisation phase, a ranger in the target character's company may tap to attempt to remove this card. Make a roll; if the result is greater than 7, discard this card.
fullCode: You've Put Your Finger In It (MM)
normalizedtitle: you've put your finger in it
DCpath: MortalMen/Youve Put Your Finger in It.jpg

NameEN: A Weapon in the Right Hands
Text: [Prowess: +1; CP: +1] Unique. Playable on the One Ring. The item cannot concealed or transferred (unless bearer is eliminated by a body check). If bearer is in Barad-dur ( or Dol Guldur if opponent is the Necromancer) he faces an attack during the site phase (alone): Maia - 1 strike with 24 prowess adn 12 body; the strike cannot be canceled, reduced, redirected, or made ineffectual. If the strike is defeated, and bearer of the One Ring is still in play after a corruption check during the end of turn phase, you win the game, otherwise you lose.
fullCode: A Weapon in the Right Hands (MM)
normalizedtitle: a weapon in the right hands
DCpath: MortalMen/A Weapon in the Right Hands.jpg

Text: [CP: 8] Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men if borne by a Man or Dunadan with a normal mind of 8 or more. Bearer may tap test any gold ring item in his company. All non-Maia, non-Nazgul, non-Undead strikes against the bearer are ineffectual. Bearer may not have followers. Bearer must make a  CP to move. Bearer may not bear non-ring items.

Unique. All gold ring items in play are now tested; start tests with the active player. Only ring special items with a printed mp of 3 or more may be played as a result of these tests; shuffle on tested gold ring items bock inot their player's decks..     Additionally, any Narya, Nenya or Vilya played this turn may be shuffled into the play deck instead of discarded. Any Ring for Mortal Men in the discard pile may be shuffled into the play deck. This card may also be played as a hazard.

Playable during the organization phase on a agent or ranger orc you have in play as character. The character now is an agent. Discard any allies, hazards, and/or Open to the Summons he controls. Turn him face down and place him at another site in the same or an adjacent region as his current site. Target agent makes a CP during his untap phase

[SP: 1] Lore. Place this card on your sage avatar when he is in play. The avatar may tap to test a gold ring in his company; afterwards he makes a CC modified by -1.     tap: if the company contains a Lost Knowledge card, to take one Test of Lore or Wisdom to Wield from your discard pile to your hand. Cannot be duplicated by a given player

Whenever a Man or Dunadan is eliminated (not by a Cc), any Man, Dunadan, Hobbit, or Wizard at the site (or in the company) may either untap or discard all hazard permanent events played on him; any character doing so makes a CC. Afterwards, discard this card

Magic. Spirit-magic. Playable on a spirit-magic-using character if his company has faced a vermin attack this turn (or if Swarm of Bats is in play on the company). This card becomes an ally under target character's control, with a prowess equal to its controller's mind (10 if an avatar). Familiar normally cannot be attacked.      tap: if opponent has a company at a site in the same or an adjacent region as Familiar, to reveal a number of cards from the top of his play deck equal to controller's mind  The first creature revealed attacks Familar. After the attack, discard the creature and shuffle all other cards back into the play deck. If the attack was successful, discard Familiar; otherwise invert Familiar, which now gives 1 ally mp. attack. Discard the creature if not defeaded and shuffle all other cards into the deck. Discard this card if a strike against Familiar is successful.  Familiar is worth 1 mp if it defeats a creature (or event).

[CP: 7] Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men, if borne by a Ringwraith or a Man or Dunadan warrior. Bearer's company becomes overt and may initiate CvCC against any other company (you receive kill mp from it). The body of all strikes against characters in the company is reduced by -1. Additionally, any item in the company has its maximum bonus to prowess and/or body increased to 10 (if lower than 10).

[CP: 6] Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men, if borne by a Dunadan or by a non-warrior Man. The body of all characters in the bearer's company is increased by 1 (to a maximum of 9). The bearer may tap and make a CP to heal a character in his company.

[CP: 8; DI: +4] Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men, if borne by a Man or Dunadan diplomat. +4 to bearer's DI. One Man or Dunadan character may be played at the bearer's current site during the organization phase, in addition to the one character per turn limit. Such character may be taken from your hand, discard pile or sideboard.

[CP: 6] Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men, if borne by a Man or Dunadan with a normal prowess of 6 or more. Bearer gains the ranger skill. The region containing his current site is also considered a Wilderness [w] for the purpose of resource play. Any hazards which affect the prowess/body of Animal attacks also affect the bearer. Your animal factions give an additional mp.

Sauron specific. Offering attempt. Playable on an opponent's character when making an influence attempt against him. Place one item from your hand or from the influencer's company (cannot be a manifestation of The One Ring or an Elven Ring) with target character. The influence attempt is modified by +4 or double the item's MP.     If the attempt is successful, you take control of target character; place this card with the item which may not be transferred. If the influence attempt fails, target character must make a CC. If he fails this check, he is taken Prisoner at the nearest Dark-hold [D] (your choice, ignore any other effects).  Rescue-attack -- 1 automatic-attack at the site must be faced again (hazard player's choice).

[CP: 8] Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men, if borne by Aragorn II or a Man or Dunadan sage. Bearer may make  a CP to cancel an Undead attack.  Additionally, bearer may tap to place 1 Undead creature played on his company with this card; the attack is cancelled and the creature becomes an ally under his control with a body equal to the bearer's and prowess equal to its normal prowess -7. It now yields ally mp as given on the card. You may opt to have it attack an opponent's company as a creature before resolving CP. Remove the creature from play afterwards.

Playable on your Ringwraith at one of his home sites outside Mordor or Mirkwood. Discard your Ringwraith and any allies and followers he controls. Place any other cards he controls with this card "off to the side"; return them to your Ringwraith when he enters play again.      Your Ringwraith may now be in a company with non-Ringwraith characters and may play Ring for Mortal Men at Barad-dur (Dol Guldur if The Necromancer is in play and Dark Spires Rising is not inverted). Any attacks keyed to Dark-domain or [d] Shadow-land [s] attack normal against your Ringwraith's company.

Playable on a character bearing a Ring for Mortal Men with Lord of Gifts. The character becomes an agent (all agent rules apply). Any resources under his control still affect the agent (as if a character). Turn the agent face down and place him at a site in an adjacent region.     Opponent may attempt to influence the agent during the site phase (treat as your character with mind 0). Discard all cards attached to this agent when he leaves active play or when he is successfully influenced by your opponent.

Playable on The One Ring. Once per turn a gold ring item in the company may be replaced with any ring special item for which it could normally be tested.   Any creature that can be keyed to Dark-hold [D] or Shadow-hold [S] may be played keyed to Ruins & Lairs [R] against the company. Cannot be duplicated.     tap: take a gold ring item from the discard pile to your hand.

NameEN: One Ring to Rule Them All
Text: [MP: (*)] Unique. Playable on The One Ring. If the bearer of The One Ring is an avatar your GI is increased by +4. All other characters in the company bearing a ring special item have their mind halved (round down) and their CP modified by an additional -1. This card is worth 1 mp for each such character. The is no limit to the bearer's company size.
fullCode: One Ring to Rule Them All (MM)
normalizedtitle: one ring to rule them all
DCpath: MortalMen/One Ring to Rule Them All.jpg

Text: Playable on a ringbearer. During a site phase reveal a character with this site as a home site, whose mind is less than half of the ringbearer's mind. Make an influence attempt against the character (as if controlled by your opponent) and add the mp of the a ring he controls, if successful the character becomes and ally under the ringbearer's control, he may carry items, but may not make no influence attempts or play allies. Character requires no influence to control. Otherwise discard this card and the character, the ringbearer makes CP modified by -2

[MP: 7] Unique. Playable on your Ringwraith at Dol Guldur, if he bears a Ring for Mortal Men, you have in play at least 4 unique factions and characters worth 7 or more mp. If Dark Spires Rising is in play this card must be played at Barad-dur instead. Your Ringwraith faces an attack: Fallen-Maia -- 1 strike with 24 prowess (cannot be cancelled or redirected; any character wounded by the attack is eliminated).

[MP: 4;  CP: 3; Mind: +2; DI: +4; P/B: +1/(+3)] White player only. Man Ring. Playable at Dol Guldur on a character bearing a gold ring item. May also be played at any site after facing a Nazgul attack or after initiating CvCC involving a Ringwraith. Discard the gold ring. Target character faces an attack which cannot be cancelled, redirected or made ineffectual: Fallen Maia  -- 1 strike with 20 prowess; if successful target character is eliminated. You may include up to 9 copies of this card in your play deck and sideboard combined.      If bearer is a Man or Dunadan with mind of 6 or more: +3 to his body (to a maximum of 10) and bearer can use spirit-magic as if a Ringwraith. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

[mp: -1(1);  CP: 3; DI: +3; P/B: +1/(+3)] Man Ring. Playable after CvCC when stealing a Ring for Mortal Men from opponent's company. This item may also be played from the discard pile or sideboard. May only be transferred to a Ringwraith. Cannot be duplicated on a given character. You may include up to 9 copies of this card in your play deck and sideboard combined.      Bearer can use spirit-magic (as if a Ringwraith). This item affects a Ringwraith; he may use starter-movement and move to non-Darkhaven [K] sites. Values in parenthesis apply to a Man, Dunadan or Ringwraith bearer; +3 to body (to a maximum of 10).               tap: if borne by a Ringwraith to search your play deck or discard pile for his corresponding Unleashed card.

Lost Knowledge. Tap a scout and a sage at a Free-hold [F] or Border-hold [B] to make non-gold ring items playable at the site until the end of the turn. Opponent may bring one hazard from his sideboard or discard pile to his play deck (reshuffle).

[SP: 3] Unique. Pallando and Saruman specific. Playable if you have at least 7 SP and a Ring for Mortal Men in play. You may bring into play any Man or Dunadan character regardless of his mind. Your Man and Dunadan characters and factions are worth full mp. Your Ring for Mortal Men borne by a Man or Dunadan character are worth twice the bearer's mp.

[MP: 1] Playable on a Man or Dunadan faction, if you have a character bearing a Ring for Mortal at the site where the faction is in play. Target faction cannot not be influenced or discarded by any means. Discard this card and target faction if you do not control a Ring for Mortal Men.

[CP: 7] Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men, if borne by a Man or Dunadan. Factions and allies played or brought into play by the bearer do not tap the site. Bearer makes a CP when playing a faction or ally.

Unique. Sauron specific. This card must be played at the start of the game in lieu of a minor item. All your ring tests are modified by +2. All your companies bearing a ring item are considered overt and have their hazard limit increased by 1.      You may play Ring for Mortal Men after any ring test result of 8 or 9. You may bring a Ringwraith into play for every stored Ring for Mortal Men at the site where it is stored; a Ringwraith costs 1 point of influence to control and may be taken from your sideboard. If The One Ring is stored at Barad-dur, you may place all your stored Ring for Mortal Men on your Ringwraith characters.     You cannot win the game by bringing The One Ring to Dol Guldur or by All Else Is Conquered. If you control The One Ring and receive mp from Lord of the World, you win the game.

[CP: 7] Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men borne by a female Man or Dunadan character (or by Adunaphel the Ringwraith). Bearer may designate one male character in her company which may be controlled costing no EI; you may bring such a character into play regardless of his mind value and he must always be controlled by bearer (regardless of any hazard effects).      Additionally, +10 to bearer's influence attempts against opponent's male characters. This modification cannot be altered by any other effect.

Playable on an Orc or Troll character bearing a trophy or after facing a Vermin attack. Target character may remove a trophy he bears from the game to untap (or untap himself and another character in the company if the trophy is a Man or Dunadan creature or character).     You may discard this card to allow the company to move an extra region. Cannot be duplicated on a given character

[CP: 7] Unique. Stature card. Playable on a Ring for Mortal Men, if borne by a Dunadan. Bearer may use spells (except Sacrifice of Form) as if he were a Wizard. Additionally, bearer may tap and make a CC to take any one spell (except Sacrifice of Form) from your discard pile or sideboard to your hand.

[MP: 3; Mind: 8; DI: 2; P/B: 4/7]---W/R/D---Orc. Unique. Ice-orc. Leader. Discard on a body check result of 7. +1 prowess against Elves. +2 DI against Ice-orcs. +2 DI against the Ice-orcs and Orcs of the Bleak Mountains factions. No More Nonsense may be duplicated on Agog.          Agog receives +2 to prowess and body when at or moving to a site in the Northern Waste, and +1 prowess if The Witch-king of Angmar is in play.  Home site: Mornost.
[MP: 2; Mind: 6; DI: 0; P/B: 6/9]---W/Sc---Orc. Unique. Ice-orc. Leader. Discard on a body check result of 9. +2 DI against Orcs. +2 DI against Ice-orcs.  Home site: Kula Dularuath.

[MP: 1; Mind: 3; DI: 0; P/B: 3/8]---W/R---Orc. Unique. Ice-orc. Discard on a body check result of 8. +1 prowess if controlling a wolf ally.     tap: heal a wolf ally in the company (from wounded to tapped). Home site: Kula Dularuath.
[MP: 2; Mind: 5; DI: 1; P/B: 4/7]---W/Sa---Umit.Unique. +1 prowess against Dragons and Drakes. +2 EI against Umli. + 2 EI against the Umli Traders faction. Home site: Vasaran Ahjo.

[MP: 1; Mind: 4; DI: 0; P/B: 4/8]---W/Sc---Elf. Unique. Nando. +1 prowess when Helectil, Light of the North is in play.    tap: cancel any ongoing effects of Jaanainen for her company. Home site: any Elf-hold in the Northern Waste.
Home: any Elf-hold in the Northern Waste

Text: [MP: 1; Mind: 3; DI: 0; P/B: 5/9]---W/R---Wild-troll. Discard on a body check result of 9.  +1 prowess against Dwarves. -1/-2 to his prowess and body if not at or moving to a site in the Northern Waste. Home site: Any non-Dragon's lair Ruins & Lairs in the Northern Waste.
Home: Any non-Dragon's lair Ruins & Lairs in the Northern Waste

Text: [MP: 0; Mind: 2; DI: 0; P/B: 4/8]---W---Man. Unique. +2 prowess against Wolves and Bears.  -1 to all of his CC.  -1 to his influence checks.Home site: Hyvat Kalat, Ruskea Vene.

[MP: 1; Mind: 4; DI: 1; P/B: 3/8]---Sc/D---Man. Unique. Spirit-namer. +1 to his riddling rolls. When Karvainen enters play, he may take control of one minor rune item, which may be taken from your sideboard, discard pile, or hand. Home site: Leiri, Ruskea Vene.

[MP: 1; Mind: 3; DI: 0; P/B: 3/9]---R---Elf. Unique. Noldo. May use any bow regardless of its card text. When Kenwe Foryaren comes into play, you may search your play deck (reshuffle) or discard pile for a minor item or short-event with a healing effect. Discard if his company moves to a site not in the Northern Waste or Eriador, or if a Wizard is in his company outside the organization phase. Home site: Evermist, any Border-hold in Northern Waste.
Home: Evermist, any Border-hold in Northern Waste

Text: [MP: 1; Mind: 3; DI: 0; P/B: 3/8]---Sc---Man. Unique. Agent. +2 EI against Man factions playable in the Northern Waste or Angmar.     Agent only: tap: make any non-unique Orc creature playable against a company leaving his current Border-hold [B] or Ruins & Lairs [R] site in the Northern Waste. Home site: Carn Dum, Leiri, Ruskea Vene.

[MP: 2; Mind: 6; DI: 0; P/B: 8/5]---W---Orc. Unique. Kragbogk's prowess is only modified by -1 when wounded. Kragbogk is not affected by any command cards in his company. -3 to his influence attempts. Home site: Carn Dum.
Unique. +1 prowess when at or moving to  a site in the Northern Waste.     tap: take Looking Forward, Lossadan Sentinels, or Skis and Furcoats from your discard pile to your hand

[MP: 2; Mind: 7; DI: 2; P/B: 2/8]---Sc/R/Sa---Elf. Unique. Nando. +2 DI against Elf and Man characters and factions normally playable at a site in the Northern Waste. +2 prowess and +1 body when at or moving to a site in the Northern Waste.      When Losp'indel is at Helloth, you may keep one more card than normal in your hand. She must make a CC every organization phase while not at a site in the Northern Waste. -2 mp if eliminated. Home site: Helloth.

[MP: 1; Mind: 4; DI: 1; P/B: 4/8]---W/R---Umit. [MP: 2; Mind: 6; DI: 2; P/B: 4/9]---W/Sc/D---Man. Unique. +2 DI against Men with a home site in Eriador or the Northern Waste. +1 prowess while bearing a treasure. May not be in a company with a hero Elf or Dunadan with a mind greater than his. Any CC made by Elves in his company is modified by -1. Home site: Bernastath, Cameth Brin.

[MP: 1; Mind: 4; DI: 0; P/B: 5/8]---W---Orc. Unique. Ice-orc. Discard on a body check result  of 8. If Nadash controls a wolf ally and is at or moving to a site in the Northern Waste, he gains the scout skill. Home site: Kula Dularuath.

[MP: 3; Mind: 8; DI: 3; P/B: 4/8]---Sa/D---Elf. Unique. Noldo. +2 DI against Elves. When Nestador is at Evermist, you may keep one more card than normal in your hand. Healing cards and effects affect all characters in his company. -3 mp if eliminated. Home site: Evermist.

Unique. Ice-orc. Discard on a body check result of 8. Hatred may be duplicated on Nog. When Agog is eliminated, you may bring Nog into play with Agog's company (after the attack) that phase, taken from your sideboard or hand

[MP: 1; Mind: 3; DI: 1; P/B: 3/8]---W/D---Man. Unique. +1 prowess against Animals and Wolves. Any flattery or offering attempt against (characters in) his company is cancelled. Foolish Words does not affect him.     tap: cancel a Trap attack against his company. Home site: Jaakylat, Pieni Satama.

[MP: 1; Mind: 4; DI: 0; P/B: 4/8]---W/R---Man. Unique. Agent. +1 prowess when Mordo is in play. -1 prowess if not at or moving to a site in the Northern Waste.     Agent only: may not be revealed at a site that is not in the Northern Waste.     tap: make one non-unique Undead creature playable at his current non-Free-hold site this turn. Home site: Jaakylat, Pieni Satama.

[MP: 2; Mind: 6; DI: 1; P/B: 5/8]---W/R---Man. Unique. +1 prowess against Orcs. +2 DI against Umli and characters and factions playable at his home site. Raudabern suffers no penalty to his prowess when he is tapped or wounded. Home site: Ligr Wodaize Berne.

[MP: 0; Mind: 2; DI: 0; P/B: 3/7]---W/Sc---Unit. Unique. +1 prowess when at or moving to a   site in the Northern Waste.     tap: take one Profitable Trade from your discard pile to your hand. Home site: Vasaran Ahjo.

Home: any site in a Wilderness in the Northern Waste

Text: [MP: 3; Mind: 9; DI: 3; P/B: 5/9]---W/Sa/D---Dunadan. Unique. Can use sorcery and shadow-magic.  Once during the organization phase, you may wound another character in his company and discard a magic card from hand to take a magic card from your discard pile or sideboard to your hand. Home site: Carn Dum, Litas

Unique. +1 prowess when at or moving to a site in the Northern Waste. If Old Grudge is in play, all Umit characters in his company receive +1 prowess againsts Giants and Drakes Home Site: Puolihmisten Satam

[MP: 1; Mind: 4; DI: 0; P/B: 4/8]---W/Sa---Orc. Unique. Ice-orc. Discard on a body check result of 8. +2 DI against Ice-orcs. Healing effects affect all Orcs in his company.     tap: modify the mind of any one Orc at his current site by +1 or -1 this turn. Home site: Kula Dularuath.

[MP: 1; Mind: 4; DI: 1; P/B: 2/9]---R/Sa---Dunadan. Unique. Spirit-namer. +2 DI against Men and Umli factions and characters playable in the Northern Waste. [MP: 4*; P/B: 17/9] Unique. Maia. Animal. Whale. One strike. May be played keyed to any Coastal Sea region [c] in The Northern Waste. Before strikes are assigned, make a roll (modified by -2 if the company is overt). [Avatar GI: 20; DI: 3; P/B: 9/12]---W/Sa/D---Ringwraith. Unique. Manifestation of The Witch-king of Angmar. Leader. +3 DI against Orc, Troll, and Man factions. May move using starter movement to Orc-holds and Troll-holds. For each faction in his current site's region, he may control one Ringwraith follower. One such follower may be played at his current site each organization phase. If at a site in one of your factions' current region, his company may use region movement; if you have no faction in the region of the company's site at the beginning of the site phase, replace their site with nearest Darkhaven [K]. Home site: Carn Dum, Minas Morgul.

Playable on a non-avatar character if your opponent has a mustering card in play. Target character receives -2 mind, -1 DI and -1 prowess (all to a minimum of 1). Discard this card when target character heals. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.
Playable on a faction that can move but is not moving. If target faction can legally do so it must now move to one of your factions' current region (opponent's choice).

Playable on a unique faction not in its home region. -1 to target faction's prowess when attacking in faction battles. Discard if target faction initiates and wins a faction battle. Cannot be duplicated on a given faction.

Attacks from ahunt Dragon manifestations affect any factions moving through a region affected by such a manifestation. Treat such an attack as a faction battle; the ahunt Dragon has a base prowess equal to its kill mp and the hazard player makes its roll. Any moving factions affected by target ahunt Dragon defend in the same battle. If the defending faction(s) wins, the ahunt Dragon is discarded.

Environment. If Doors of Night is in play, hero factions may move 1 less region.   If Gates of Morning is in play, minion factions may move 1 less region. Once this card is in play it is considered neither a resource nor a hazard. Cannot be duplicated.

Playable on a faction's home region, if the faction is in play and not in the region (or at a site therin). The region's type moves one step closer to a Wilderness [w]. Discard if a faction with target region as its home region is in the region. Cannot be duplicated on a given region.

Corruption. Playable on opponent's avatar if he has a mustering card in play. Target avatar receives 1 CP for each faction he has in play that is not in its home region. Target avatar makes a CP whenever an opposing faction is eliminated. Whenever one of target player's factions is wounded or eliminated, he may make a roll: if the result is greater than 8, discard this card.

Playable on a faction, if you have a revealed  agent at his home site in the faction's current region. Target faction may not move and gives one less mp. If a strike from an attack by this agent fails, place this card in your opponent's mp; it is worth 4 mp.

Factions cannot move through a region that is the current region of a faction of the opposing alignment; they may still move to or from such a region and if their movement through such a region is already declared they must stop in the region. Additionally, garrisonned factions cannot move to or battle in their current region.
Unique. All factions receive a +2 to their prowess in faction battles. Any faction wounded by a faction battle is automatically eliminated.

This card may be taken from your sideboard and shuffled into your play deck if your opponent has a mustering card in play. As a permanent-event, playable on a faction. Target faction may not move (regardless of conflicting resources). Cannot be duplicated on a faction.     As a short-event, bring one Muster Disperses from your sideboard or discard pile to your hand and remove this card from the game.

Factions of the following types gain +1 prowess if in battle with an opposing faction of the corresponding pair: Orc and Elf; Troll and Ent; Man and Dunadan. Cannot be duplicated+1 to body checks if wounded by pair.

[SP: 2] Unique. Playable if you control a faction playable in Gondor. Your factions controlled by a leader in Greater Gondor reeive +1 to their faction battles. All Dwarf factions receive +1 prowess in battles with Dragon and Orc factions. Additionally, if a Dragon faction is wounded in battle with one of your Dwarf factions, you may remove this card from play to eliminate the Dragon faction.

[Body: +1] Playable on a character with a home site in a home region of one of your factions in play. +1 to body. Discard during the site phase if there is no such faction in the character's current region. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Playable on The One Ring. For each unwounded faction you have in play in Dagorlad, Imlad Morgul or Southern Mirkwood, the hazard limit is reduced by one against the bearer's company (to no minimum if any of these factions is acompanying your avatar). Cannot be duplicated
Your Dragon factions cannot not be eliminated by faction battles. Your Dragon factions heal during your untap phase. Discard if any of your Dragon factions attacks in a faction battle.

Playable on a defending faction in a faction battle before dice are rolled. Target faction must move to a region adjacent to its current region. You may bring this card from your discard pile to your play deck (rehuffle) when one of your factions is wounded.
[SP: 1] Playable on a protected Wizard-haven [H]. Your factions in this region may not be attacked and are considered to be at an Under-deeps site. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

[SP: 1] Dragon-lord specific. Hunting mode. Playable on your Dragon-lord, if any mustering card is in play. Return this card to your hand when you play another mode card, or during the organization phase if you so choose. Your Dragon-lord may use region movement (to a maximum of three regions), if moving to a site in the current region of one of opponent's factions. During the site phase, instead of entering the site, the Dragon-lord may initiate a faction battle as if he were a faction with 5 mp. You receive any eliminated faction as Gathered Bones.

Playable if you have a mustering card and a Dwarf faction in play. Your Dwarf factions may use Under-deeps movement. If you control a Dwarf character with mind 8 or more, your Dwarf factions receive +2 prowess in faction battles against Orcs. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.
When a Dwarf faction would otherwise be eliminated, opponent must make a roll; if the result is less than 8 the faction is not eliminated (and is wounded). Discard when a Dwarf faction is eliminated.

All Elf factions receive +1 to faction battles in Wilderness regions. Additionally, Elf factions receives a +1 modifier in faction battles where they are defending. Discard when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

+2 to the roll for any faction battle in which one  of your Orc or Troll factions is attacking. Additionally, for each of opponent's factions your eliminate in a faction battle, one of your factions may heal. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

[MP: 1; Mind: 4; DI: 0; P/B: 1/9]---Sc/R---Hobbit. Unique. Cannot be controlled by a Hobbit. Unless he is among the starting characters, he may only be brought into play at his home site. +1 to his corruption check.Home site: Brandy Hall.

[MP: 0; Mind: 2; DI: 0; P/B: 0/8]---Sc---Hobbit. Unique. May not be among the starting characters, and may only be brought into play at his home site. Nob costs no direct influence to control, if controlled by Barliman Butterbur or a Hobbit.     tap: tap a face-up agent at his current or new site.Home site: Bree.

[MP: 0; Mind: 2; DI: 0; P/B: 0/8]---Sc---Hobbit. Unique. +1 to his burglary attempts. Unless he is among the starting characters, he may only be brought into play at his home site. +1 to his corruption checks.Home site: Sackville.
[MP: 1; Mind: 3; DI: 1; P/B: 3/8]---W/R---Elf. Unique. Nando.   -2 prowess against Animals and Awakened Plants. +2 prowess against Orcs.Home site: Lorien, any Refuge in Mirkwood.

[MP: 1; Mind: 3; DI: 1; P/B: 1/9]---Sc/D---Hobbit. Unique. Agent. May not be among the starting characters, unless you start the game at Bag End. May only be brought into play at his home site (regardless of any other card effects).      Unless you are a Dwarf-lord or Gandalf, Mischief in a Mean Way is playable on his current site in The Shire (as if on a Border-hold [B]). Home site: Bag End, Bywater.

Playable if Doors of Night is in play. Nazgul creatures may be played against hero companies keyed to Border-land [b], Wilderness [w], and Shadow-land [s]; and to non-Haven, non-Free-hold sites in these regions. Any Nazgul attacking in this fashion is detainment, unless a character in the defending company bears a ring special item. Cannot be duplicated.

Playable on a Maia, Demon or Spawn ally. The controlling character must make an influence check against the ally. Make a roll and add the controlling character's unused EI; if the result is lower than the ally's mind +6, discard the ally.
Playable only on-guard. Reveal this card to target and cancel any card or effect that would allow opponent to bring in a character with the company during the site phase.

Playable on an attack with a prowess of 11 or more created by a unique hazard (does not count against the hazard limit).   All strikes must be assigned to a leader or to the character in the company with the highest prowess against the attack (defender's choice), regardless of his status or any card effect. Each excess strike gives a -1 modification to his prowess; Pierced by Many Wounds cannot be played on the attack.

[MP: 1; P/B: 7/0] Animal. Wolf. 2 strikes. May be played keyed to any Wilderness [w] region in Eriador or Wilderland (by name or type), and to Ruins & Lairs [R] in these regions. If there is wounded character in the company, Glutan cannot be cancelled by a skill card. Cannot be duplicated in a movement/hazard phase
Allies may not be played at tapped sites. Unless Doors of Night is in play, no ally may be played at a hero Haven [H]. Discard this card when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated.
Items cannot be stored. Any character attempting to store a non-item card must make a CP modified by -2.

Whenever a tapped Elf-hold would be returned to the location deck, place it in the controlling player's  mp instead. A player with 2 or more copies of such a site in his mp may not play any other copy of it. Cannot be duplicated.
Playable on a hero company facing a Nazgul attack. Tap all characters in the company with mind lower than the number of Nazgul permanent-events in play.

All hero characters bearing a gold ring item must make a CP at the beginning of their movement/ hazard phase. This CP is modified by -6 when moving through Gorgoroth or a Dark-Domain [d]. Cannot be duplicated.

Any company that wants to play a Lost Knowledge card, or fullfil the requirement of Lost Knowledge being discarded, must tap a sage in addition to any other requirements. Discard this card when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated.

Cancels the effects of Secret Entrance and Forewarned is Forearmed. Additionally, each company intending to move with Under-deeps movement must make an Under-deeps movement roll for each adjacent site during their organization phase. This is done before a new site is selected and instead of during the movement/hazard phase. Such a roll is modified by -3, but if successful the site may be taken from location deck or discard pile. Discard this card when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated.
Playable on a horse ally. Discard the ally if its company enters a Shadow-hold [S] or Dark-hold [D] this turn, or is moving to an Under-deeps site or Dungeon. Cannot be revealed as an on-guard card.
[MP: 2*; P/B: 10/8] Dunedain. 5 strikes. Only playable against minion companies. May be played keyed to Arthedain, Cardolan or The Shire. +2 prowess against Ringwraiths.
Attacking hazard creatures may assign strikes to any hero ringbearer before other strikes are assigned. If such a strike is assigned to the bearer of The One Ring, the strike receives +2 prowess.

Playable on a Shadow-hold [S], Dark-hold [D], or hidden site against a moving hero company. Cannot be revealed as an on-guard card. Unless the company contains a sage or a Hobbit, or you discard a Knowledge or Information card from hand or the company, the company must do nothing during the site phase. Additionally, cancels the effects of Crack in the Wall and Secret Entrance.

Corruption. Playable on a non-avatar ranger. Target character receives 1 corruption point and makes a CP when a resource requiring the ranger skill is played on a character in his company. During the organization phase at his home site or a Haven [H] (or site that acts as a Haven for the purpose of healing) the character may tap to attempt to remove this card and make a roll: if the result is greater than 6, discard this card. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Playable on My Precious. -1 to My Precious' prowess and he may not be turned face down. If he was at the same site of an opponent's company during the organization phase, he may take one agent action to move to that company's new site (if allowed to move there). If a company controlling a ring or treasure item enters his current site, My Precious must attack during the site phase. Discard this card if My Precious attacks and is not successful.

Playable on a ring. Rotate this card 90deg (or add a token) each time target character faces a strike. At the end of his movement/hazard phase target character makes a CP, modified by subtracting the number of times this card is rotated (or number of tokens); If he fails the CP, discard the ring (ignore any other effects) and remove this card from the game. Otherwise, restore this card (remove the tokens). Cannot be duplicated on a given ring.
Playable on a sage. Target character loses the sage skill. Discard this card if his company moves with at least two regions in their site path or to a non-Haven Under-deeps site.

Playable on a Haven [H] if the bearer of The One Ring is there. Any non-minion company at the site faces 3 attacks (cannot be cancelled by any card effect) at the beginning of the site phase: Orcs -- 5 strikes with 8 prowess; Trolls-- 3 strikes 10 prowess; Nazgul -- 2 strikes with 13 prowess. Discard The One Ring if any strike against its bearer is successful. If all attacks are defeated, place this card in opponents mp.   The bearer of The One Ring cannot leave the site while this card is in play. Cannot be duplicated.

NameEN: A Blazing Fire and a Mug of Beer
Text: [MP: 1; CP: +1; Body: +1] Unique. Playable on Barliman Butterbur at Bree. +1 body. +1 to all of his CP. Barliman may tap to bring one Glamour of Surpassing Excellence, Marvels Told, or Memories Recalled from your sideboard or discard pile to your play deck (reshuffle). Discard this card if Barliman is at a site not in Arthedain or The Shire, or if he is at a Haven [H].
fullCode: A Blazing Fire and a Mug of Beer (RS)
normalizedtitle: a blazing fire and a mug of beer
DCpath: ReturnShadow/A Blazing Fire and a Mug of Beer.jpg

Text: [MP: 1, Mind: 2, P/B: 2/8]---Ranger.  Unique. Horse. Playable at any non-haven site in Cardolan or Rhudaur. Characters with a home site Rivendell may play this ally at a tapped site. If its controlling character is the only character in the company, he may move 3 additional  non-Coastal Sea regions when moving to a site where another company is present, and Asfaloth may tap to give +2 to any of his CC this turn. TAP to cancel a Nazgul attack, or a strike (not from an AA) against its bearer or itself.

[MP: 0; CP: 1] Tap bearer and discard this item to replace it with one non-unique, non-hoard minor item (not a Backpack) from your discard pile or sideboard (or two such items if bearer is Sam Gamgee).   A given character may bear only one Backpack

[MP: 0; CP: 1] Food item. Playable at a site in The Shire or at Bree (does not tap the site). Discard this item to cancel any effect that forces the company to do nothing during the site phase: you may not play resources worth any mp with the company this turn. This item is considered a minor item for the purpose of using Backpack if the bearer of Backpack is a Hobbit.

[MP: 1, Mind: 2, P/B: 1/8]---Scout. Unique. Hobbit. Playable at Bree. Also playable at any site in Arthedain or The Shire, if you discard (for no effect) a Memories Recalled. A company containing Barliman Butterbur may play Bob at tapped sites.    tap: fullfill the requirement of discarding Lost Knowledge for a card played with/on his company.

Playable at the beginning of the movement/hazard phase (but after cards are drawn) on your avatar if his company moves through a region containing a Dark-hold [D] or region adjacent).  Untap target character if tapped, he splits off from the company and forms his own company with the same site path as his original company.  He immediately faces a separate movement/hazard phase with a hazard limit of two.  Creatures keyed to Dark-hold may always be played against his company.  Afterwards, he is considered "off to the side" until he joins his original company at any time during their site phase.

Play to bring one hero ally discarded from play this turn from your discard pile to your hand.  Alternatively, playable at any time when on of your hero allies needs to be discarded from play:  bring the ally to your hand instead.

[MP: 0; CP: 1] Ranger only: tap: cancel any effect this turn that would replace the company's new site (except effects from hazards played on a ringbearer or from magic resources).      Sage only: tap: if a Knowledge or Lore card is in the company to fulfill all requirements to reveal or move to a hidden site.      Bearer makes a CP when this item becomes tapped.

Lore.  -3 to your SP.  Any hero player may tap an Elf, Dwarf, Dunadan, or Wizard (or any character he has in play at Rivendell) to allow any action that required him to search through his discard pile or play deck that phase (regardless of other cards in play; even during opponent's turn).Discard if you are a Falled-wizard and have 3 SP or less, or if Elrond is in play but not at Rivendel.  Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Play to cancel a spell (before it resolves). If played as a resource, tap a Demon, Maia or Spawn character or ally you have in play at the same site as the spell playing character. May also be played during opponent's site phase.This card may also be played as a hazard. Discard a Demon, Maia, or Spawn hazard event you have in play and make a roll (modified by +5 if the event could generate an attack at the spell playing character's current or new site); if the result is greater than 10, spell is cancelled.

Unique.  Manifestation of Saruman.  Playable on a non-overt company with on avatar or Hobbits.  You may play spells on the company as if on Saruman (except Sacrifice of Form).  Each character in the company may tap to use a Palantir he bears.  You may tap two sages in the company to take a ritual from the discard pile to your hand, or tap a character able to use a spell to take a spell from the discard pile to your hand.  Invert this card during your untap phase, if inverted, discard at the end of your turn.Discard if a character manifestation of Saruman comes into play.

Playable during the organization phase on a grey agent you have in play as character. The character now is an agent. Discard any allies, hazards, and/or Draw Swords Together he controls. Turn him face down and place him at another site in the same or an adjacent region as his current site. Target agent must make a CP during his untap phase.

[MP: 2] Trophy. Playable on the highest mind character (avatar if present) in the company after an attack from a non- detainment Maia creature, if all strikes have failed and the creature is still in play. May also be played on your avatar, if a strike against him from an opponent's Wizard or Lord in CvCC has failed. [MP: 2] Discard the Maia/Wizard/Lord if still in play; keep any stage cards in play and place any non-ally cards "off to the side". Opponent may take his avatar from his discard pile to his hand during the next turn after the play of this card and take control of the cards placed off to the side. This card yields trophy mp.

Playable during the organization phase on an item borne by a character in a company of 3 or more characters at a Haven [H]. Item is "concealed." While concealed, the item is worth half its mp (round down), gives 0 Ccorruption points, and cannot be used. Concealed items cannot be discarded or stored and are not affected by hazards or resources. Discard this card if the company size is below 3, during the organization phase if you so choose, if bearer becomes wounded in CvCC.
Playable during the organization phase on a company at a port-on-river site containing a scout or a ranger. The company may move with port movement to any site with the same port-on-river keyword.

[MP: 2] Unique. Playable at Isildur's Tomb or Daeron's Pool if the influence check is greater than 10.   Standard Modifications: if an Eagle ally, Gandalf or Radagast is in the company (+3). May not be influenced by a character in an overt company.     If you are a Wizard or Elf-lord, you may play Spying out the Land as if it were a spell instead of magic (ignore the playability requirements).

Spell. Wizard only. Playable on a company. The company's current site is considered a hidden site. For any other company, to reveal this site as a new site and/or move through the region containing the site, make a roll and add the mind of any character and ally in the company that taps (10 for avatar): if the result is less than 12 the company may not move to the site or through the region. Wizard makes a CP modified by -2. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

[MP: 0; CP: 1; DI: +1] Jewel. Treasure. May not be a starting minor item, unless your starting company includes a Dunadan ranger with a home site in Eriador. May only be played after a successful influence attempt against a Dunadan or Elf faction at a site in Eriador.   Ranger only: +1 DI against Dunedain and Elves.     tap: give bearer the warrior skill this turn.     tap: allow bearer to play Wielded Twice as if he were a sage this turn.

[MP: 1; CP: +1] Unique. Playable only on Strider or Thorongil, if he is at a Haven [H] or in a company with a Wizard or Elf-lord. +1 to his CP.    tap: cancel an effect in the same chain-of-effects that required an agent at his site to tap.

[MP: 1; Mind: 2; P/B: 1/8] Unique. Horse. Playable at a tapped or untapped Tom's House by the character controlling Tom Bombadil or Goldberry.      tap: cancel any hazard effect that would discard an ally, or return an ally that has been discarded this turn from your discard pile to your hand.

Playable on a company at the end of the organization phase. Tap a ranger and a scout (or an avatar with either of these skills). The company may (attempt to) move to an Under-deeps site with a surface site in the same or an adjacent region as their current site; or vice versa. They are considered to use both region and Under-deeps movement. Any required roll for moving to/from the surface site must still be made.             Alternatively, tap a ranger or a scout to fulfill all requirements for moving to a hidden site.

Playable on a company facing an attack created by an on-guard creature. The attack cannot be cancelled and must be faced by your avatar or the highest prowess character in the company (your choice; as if a single character company). After the attack, this character splits from the company, and you must choose a new site card for the company in the same or an adjacent region. Tap all untapped characters and allies in target company, and opponent may play two hazards on the company (as if they were moving to the site during the movement/hazard phase).

Ritual.  Playable on a staff borne by an avatar during the site phase at a Ruins & Lairs [R].  Tap the bearer.+1 to all his CC required for rituals, spells and light enchantments.tap:  give +2 to all Under-deeps movement rolls required for bearer's company.tap:  give -2 prowess to an Undead attack against bearer's company.Bearer makes a CC when this card becomes tapped.Cannot be duplicated on a given staff.

[MP: 0; CP: 0] Playable on the bearer of The One Ring at a Haven [h]H] (even if he is tapped or wounded). Place and keep this card with The One Ring, which now gives 1 fewer  mp and 1 fewer corruption point. If the bearer uses The One Ring or any of its bonuses, he must immediately make a CP. This item gives 0 corruption points.

Unique. Playable on Tom Bombadil. If in a company with Goldberry, Tom Bombadil is not discarded as per his card text. Discard this card if he is not in a company with Goldberry, or with your Wizard or Elf-lord.

Playable during the organization phase on Gandalf. If his company contains no other characters and allies (except unique horse allies), Gandalf gains the ranger skill this turn. He may move up to five regions, and his company's hazard limit is reduced by one (to a minimum of one).

Playable on a Noble Hound if his company is facing a creature attack (before assigning strikes). Make a roll and add Noble Hound's prowess; if the result is greater than the creature's prowess (including all modifications, add +1 for each of its attacks), all of its attacks are defeated (place it in your mp). Otherwise, the Noble Hound is eliminated.

All hero characters with mind less than 6 and normal prowess less than 4 gain +1 prowess and +1 DI. Each avatar and hero character with mind greater than 7 must make a roll at the end of their organization phase. If the result is less than 5, that character is tapped.   Discard when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated.

Playable on a character whose strike was successful during CvCC this turn. Name a battle-gear item borne by the character your target character has defeated in CvCC this turn, and make a roll, modified by +2 if target character bears a weapon (+3 if the weapon is unique); if the result is greater than 9, discard the named item. This card may be played during your opponent's turn.

Horse.  Playable by a Hobbit at Bree or site in The Shire (even if the site is tapped).  Discard if it moves to a Dungeon or Under-deeps site +1 prowess if in a company with a unique horse ally.  Counts as Hobbit for the purpose of playing Halfling-strength.  You may shuffle any More Sense than You played on an entity in its company into your play deck.

[MP: (*)] Playable on The One Ring if its bearer is at a Haven [H]. Rotate this card 90deg (or place a token) each time a Wizard or character with  mind 6 or more at the same site (other than the bearer) passes a CP. This may only be done once per turn, and once per game for each given character. This card is worth 1 mp for each time rotated. Cannot be duplicated.

[MP: 0; CP: 1] Playable on a character at Dimrill Dale. Untap or heal the character (from wounded to tapped) or untap the site; you may  take an Information resource from your discard pile to your hand. Target character makes a CP (modified by -1 if a Dwarf).      All automatic-attacks at Dimrill Dale receive +1 to prowess and strikes. While at Dimrill Dale, target character does not untap normally during his untap phase. Discard this card if he is not at Dimrill Dale. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Spell. Wizard only. -2 prowess to all Dragon and Ringwraith characters at the site this turn. Any Ringwraith must be taken to hand on a body check result of 6 or 9 (unless killed by the check). This card may also be played during opponent's site phase, and in response to a resource played by/on a Dragon or Ringwraith at the same site: his company must immediately engage in CvCC with the Wizard's company. Wizard makes a CP modified by -3.

Playable on a non-overt character at his home site. Heal (from wounded to tapped) another character in his company, or untap another character of the same race in his company. The other character must not be at his home site.

Playable during the organization phase on your Wizard. Tap your Wizard to look at the top 7 cards of any play deck. The Wizard may choose to face one creature thus revealed as if a single character company (discard creature after the attack). Any attack against the Wizard's company by (copies of) this creature is cancelled for the rest of the turn. Return the other cards to the top of the play deck in any order you choose.

Playable at the end of the organization phase on your Elf-lord or Wizard (not Saruman), if at Isengard or a non-Under-deeps Shadow-hold [S] or Dark-hold [D]. You may move with flying movement to any Haven [H] or Free- hold [F] in the same or an adjacent territory, if the company size is equal to or lower than the number of following cards in the company (allies without flying ability count as characters): Gwaihir, Meneldor, Winged Change Master, The Windlord Found Me.

Playable on Gollum or Stinker. He is considered a Hobbit for all purposes and must make a CP modified by -2 during the untap phase. +2 to his riddling rolls. Additionally, you may tap him to take a gold ring item playable at his current site, or a manifestation of an item borne by an opponent's character at the site, from your discard pile to your hand.

[MP: 2; Mind: 3; P/B: 5/7]---Warrior. Unique. Eagle. Winged. Playable at Eagle's Eyrie.  May also be played at the (tapped) site where you have played The Windlord Found Me this turn, if an Elf-lord or Wizard (not Saruman) is in the company. You may store The Windlord Found Me at any Free-hold [F], and may play any one character from your discard pile or play deck when storing it (as if a Wizard at a Haven [H]). Discard Meneldor when his company moves to an Under-deeps site or a Dungeon, or if the company is overt.

Unique.  Playable on Frodo.  You may start the game with this card in lieu of a minor item.  In addition to adopting the given attributes, Frodo's skills become scout.  Discard if Frodo uses a ring, or if his company moves to a site not in The Shire or its adjacent regions.  tap: during the end-of-turn phase to take on Halfling Stealth from your discard pile to your hand.

Any company sent back to its site of origin may still play cards and take actions the same turn.     Additionally, any player may discard this card to cancel the effects of a hazard that would return a company to its site of origin or replace that company's new site, if moving to a site where another of his companies is located.     Cannot be duplicated.

Playable on a Haven [H] or Free-hold [F]. Your characters at the site may transfer any allies they control to other characters with equal or higher mind (or to an avatar) who do not control such an ally. Afterwards, tap the ally if untapped.     Discard this card when the site leaves active play. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

Playable on a Free-hold [F] or Border-hold [B] where you have a unique faction in play. At the end of the organization phase you may discard this card to take up to 2 food minor items from your sideboard and place them with different characters in a moving company (characters need not tap to receive these items). Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

Playable after a failed strike of an agent attack against the company. A character in the company may tap to play a non-unique ally or Bill the Pony.     Alternatively, playable during CvCC after a successful strike against a character controlling a non-unique ally (or Bill the Pony). Discard an ally of your choice controlled by the character.

Playable on a scout, ranger or sage. If a sage, you may tap him during the organization phase to draw a card. If a ranger, you may tap him during the movement/hazard phase to draw a card. If a scout, you may tap him during the site phase to draw a card. Discard if the character is at a Haven [H,K] or Dark-hold [D]. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Playable on a non-Hobbit scout or a non-sage, non-diplomat ranger. Minor items borne by him which include his race or any of his skills in their card text or title do not give him any corruption points. Discard if bearer's company does not (attempt to) move. This card may be played in lieu of a minor item with a character in your starting company.

Playable during your opponent's site phase, if your opponent makes an influence attempt against one of your characters. Based on that character's mind, you may modify opponent's roll by the following:  1-4 mind: -2; 5-7 mind: -3; 8+ mind: -4.     Alternatively, play to cancel an offering or flattery attempt against one of your characters.

Playable on a Haven [H] or Free-hold [F]. All characters at the site receive +2 to their CP when transferring non-ring items between characters of the same race or with the same home site. Additionally, all characters at the site may transfer items during their end-of-turn phase. Discard this card if the site leaves active play, or after a failed CP forced by transferring items at this site

[MP: 1; Mind: 1; P/B: 1/8] Unique. Animal. Playable at any tapped or untapped Ruins & Lairs [R] in The Shire or its adjacent regions. +1 to any trickery, burglary, flattery or riddling attempt made by a character in his company.     tap: cancel a strike (not from an automatic-attack) against himself.

Unique. Playable on Rhosgobel. One hero ally with the keyword flying is playable with Radagast at the site each turn. Additionally, such allies may heal at Rhosgobel. This card gives -2 SP to a Fallen-wizard player. Discard this card if Rhosgobel leaves active play.

Ritual. Playable on a sage at the beginning of the site phase (before facing any automatic-attacks). Tap the sage. Any ongoing hazard effect that causes the company to do nothing during the site phase is now cancelled (and this card may be played regardless of such effects).

Playable on a moving company containing a Hobbit. Tap all Hobbits in the company. At the end of the movement/hazard phase you may take another movement/hazard phase and move to another site: the company must move with region movement, to a maximum of 3 regions.     This card may also be played as a hazard; instead of all Hobbits, defender must tap one Hobbit in the company (or 1 Hobbit and Fatty Bolger).

[MP: 0; CP: 1] Food item. Playable at any site in the Shire or at Bree (and also if the site is tapped). Discard this item to discard a Despair of the Heart or Alone and Unadvised played on a character in the company; target character makes a body check modified by -1. Failing the body check wounds, but does not eliminate the character.     A Hobbit bearer may discard this item to receive +3 prowess and -2 body untill the end of the turn; target Hobbit cannot use Halfling Stealth, Sneakin' or Stealth, and any ongoing effect of these cards is cancelled.

[MP: (-1)] Unless you have 10 SP or more, you may reserve one card face down with this card. During your end-of- turn phase you may take the reserved card back into your hand and discard this card.     Any opponent may use 2 against the hazard limit (only 1 if he is Sauron or has a Palantir in play) of one of your companies to look at the reserved card; if it is not a resource, the reserved card is revealed and discarded, and this card is placed in your mp; it is worth -1 mp (even to a Fallen-wizard).

[MP: 1; CP: 1; DI: +2; Prowess: +1(2)] Unique. Weapon. Playable at Michel Delving. May also be played at any site in The Shire by The Thain or a character bearing Mathom Lore. +1 to prowess. Hobbit Warrior only: +2 prowess and +2 DI against Hobbits.

[MP: 3; Mind: 3; P/B: 6/9]---Sage. Unique. Playable at The Willow Dingle. +2 prowess against Hobbits. Discard if its company is at or moving to a site not in Old Forest. TAP: cancel an Awakened Plant attack against one of your companies in Eriador.

Unique. Playable on Bree. Tap a non-overt character during the site phase at Bree to make Information or News from the Shire playable there this turn.  Any player may tap an agent at Bree to make Nazgul creatures playable at the site (not counting against the hazard limit if a ringbearer is present). Afterwards, discard this card.  Discard this card if Bree leaves active play.

[MP: 3] Unique. Playable at The Willow Dingle if the influence check is greater than 11. Standard Modifications: eliminate a character or prisoner from the company (+5), The Great Willow is in the company (+5). No resources may be played to modify this attempt.     Cannot move.      tap: if The Great Willow is in the company to give -3 prowess to all attacks the company faces this turn while at a site in Old Forest.

Playable on a company during the organization phase if you discard a food item from the company. Whenever you play a card on the company with 'Fair Travels' in its title, you may untap up to two characters in the company or remove one corruption card from such a character.     You may discard this card from play to cancel an effect that would replace the company's new site with another site. Cannot be duplicated on a given company.

Unique.  Playable on Aragorn II if you have revealed a Wizard and your Wizard is not in play.  +1 to his mind, prowess, and body, and +3 DI.  Target character may tap during the organization phase to shuffle one resource or character from your sideboard into your play deck.  When eliminated, he -3 MP (instead of -5, place this card in your MP)  You may take this card from your sideboard or discard pile to your hand when you play Sacrifice of Form.  Discard this card when your Wizard enters play.

Playable on a company.  During their organization phase, discard from hand a Forod, Rhun, Harad or Belegaer to allow the company to move one extra region that turn if moving to a site in respectively The Northern Waste, The Great Central Plains, The Sun-lands, or a Coastal Sea [c] region; their hazard limit is reduced by one (to a minimum of two).  You may start the game with this card in lieu of playing a minor item.

Lore. Playable on a character at Ettenmoors.     If a Hobbit, target character gains the sage skill, and this card may be stored at Bag End for 1 mp. Any hazard player may reserve a card face-down under  this card (counting as 1 against the hazard limit). Only  one card can be reserved with this card at any time. During opponent's movement/hazard phase the hazard player may play his card from under this card as if played from hand (except short-events). During his end-of-turn phase a player may take his card back to hand.      If this card is discarded, reveal and discard any card under it: if it is not a hazard, place this card in the controlling player's mp. -1 to your handsize if this card is in your mp.

[MP: 2*, P/B: 12/7] Unique. Man. Manifestation of Theoden. 2 strikes. As a creature, may be played keyed to Enedwaith, Gap of Isen, Rohan and Anorien,  and at non-Haven sites in these regions. Detainment against hero and covert companies.    As a long-event, any non-flying company without a horse ally at a site in the above named regions cannot reveal a new site that is not in the above named regions.

Playable on a moving company. Opponent must discard the top card of his play deck (he may look at the card) or bring a number of random cards equal to the company size from his discard pile to his play deck and shuffle (hazard player's choice). Opponent may cancel the second effect by shuffling the same number of random cards from his hand to his play deck instead. Remove this card from the game.

Playable on a company with a majority of Man, Dwarf, Orc and/or Troll characters. All Awakened Plant attacks receive +2 prowess against the company this turn. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn for a given company.

[MP: 1; P/B: 10/0] Pukel-creature. Animal. {Shadow-hold}  1 strike. May only be played as the first hazard creature played this movement/hazard phase; any subsequent hazard creatures keyed to the same site cost 2 against the hazard limit.    May also be played at Ruins & Lairs [R] sites in the following regions: Andrast, Anfalas, Anorien, Dunland, Enedhwaith, Gap of Isen, Lamedon, Old Pukel Gap, Old Pukel-land, and Rohan.

[MP: 1; P/B: 10/0] Undead. {Double Wilderness, Shadow-lands} 2 strikes. May also be played keyed to a swamp. Any character wounded by Mewlips must discard one non-ring item (defender's choice). If Mewlips is defeated, a character in the company may tap to play a minor or major item from hand or discard pile.

Play to target a card opponent has reserved faced down or has placed off to the side (cannot be a character or agent); opponent must reveal target card and bring it to his hand, or place this card in his MP, a player's hand size is reduced by one for the purpose of resolving hand size after any movement/hazard phase.

Each non-unique Undead creature may be played keyed to a swamp.    Additionally, if Doors of Night is in play, each Undead creature playable keyed to a swamp by name or type may also be keyed to the region containing the swamp.

Playable on a company facing a non-detainment Demon, Dragon, Drake or Spawn attack (does not count against the hazard limit). For every ally in the company make a roll (modified by +2 if the ally is unique); if the result plus the ally's mind plus its controlling character's mind is less than the creature's base prowess, the ally is tapped. If the modified result is less than the base prowess minus 7, discard the ally.

Each company moving through Fangorn or Old Forest must make a roll: subtract 1 for each character and for each Dwarf and Orc in the company, add 2 for each Ent ally in the company. If the result is less than 5, the company faces an attack: Awakened plant -- 3 strikes with 10 prowess.        Additionally, each player may use one against the hazard limit to discard one Awakened Plant creature and add one Wilderness [w] to the site path of a company moving through at least one Wilderness [w] or Border-land [b]. A ranger, avatar or Ent ally in the company may tap to prevent this. Cannot be duplicated.  Alternatively, discard this card from play to tap an Ent ally.

[MP: 1; P/B: 13/6] Unique. Animal. Boar. Manifestation of Wild Boar of Everhold. 1 strike. Playable keyed to Rohan and Fangorn. May also be played keyed to Druadan Forest.       If this creature is defeated and a Man character has faced 1 of its strikes, he may take it as a trophy; character receives +1DI and +1 prowess.

Unique.  Fire-dragon.  May be played at Turukulon's Lair.  3 strikes.  If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Dunland, Enedwaith, Hollin, Misty Mountains - Southern Spur, and Redhorn Gate, and to non-Haven, non-Free-hold sites in these regions.

Unique.  Manifestation of Turukulon.  Place this card with a non-Dragon's Lair Ruins & Lairs [R] in a mountain region (or with at least 3 Wildernesses [w] or 2 Deserts [e] in its site path, but not in Mirkwood); you may also take the site from your location deck.  Target site does not leave active play until this card leaves play.  Any version of the site gains an additional automatic-attack:  Dragon - 3 strikes with 12/7 prowess/body.  This card is considered an at home manifestation, it cannot be revealed as an on-guard card.

Reveal My Precious at a site where a company containing Gollum or Stinker is present: Gollum/Stinker immediately attacks a character in the company bearing an item (attacker chooses). After the attack, if the attack was successfull, discard Gollum/Stinker. Otherwise, turn My Precious face down and heal Gollum/Stinker (if still in play).
Mountain Region - Southern SpurDunland, Gap of Isen, Fangorn, Hollin, Redhorn Gate

[SP: 1] Playable (at any time) on your avatar if you tap two characters with two different skills in his company. Your avatar receives +3P and -3 DI this turn; untap him if tapped. Cannot be duplicated in a given turn.

[SP: 1] Place this card on your avatar when he is in play. You may tap your avatar to look at half the number of cards in opponent's hand (at random; round up if opponent is of the same alignment, round down otherwise). Avatar makes a CP.

[MP: 1] Playable during the site phase on Glittering Caves,  if you have a Dwarf with mind of 5 or more at the site. The company faces an attack (cannot be cancelled): Pukel-creature -- 2 strikes with 8 prowess. Tap a Dwarf after the attack or discard this card. All versions of Glittering Caves become a Border- hold [B] and a Dwarf-hold; all automatic- attacks are cancelled for your companies. This site is never discarded and never untaps for you. Cannot be duplicated.

NameEN: Almost Felt You Liked the Forest!?
Text: Playable on an Ent ally. The ally may face strikes from automatic-attacks and attacks keyed to his company's site this turn.    Alternatively, play to cancel an Animal, Spider or Awakened Plant attack against your company
fullCode: Almost Felt You Liked the Forest!? (TI)
